loans.name: Mary- Ann

texts.en:
Mary- Ann is studying for a BS in Information Technology at MU Oroqueita City. Mary- Ann joined Gata Daku MPC and she used her previous loan in paying her first semester tuition fees.

Recently she took another loan to pay her school tuition fees for the second semester. She is hopeful of finding a job after finishing her studies to be able to support the needs of her parents and to have a better future of her own.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Genny Mae

texts.en:
Genny Mae is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Accountancy at Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City. Her parents are both private employees but,  having six siblings, their income is not good enough to support all their family's needs.

She used her previous loan from GDMPC in paying her school tuition fees for the first semester.  To continue her studies, she now took another loan to pay her uniforms used for her on-the-job training activities. Her ambition is to finish her studies.  She wants to help her parents and the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the first semester

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is married with two children and she helps her husband operating their little farm to make a living. With three years of harvesting bananas, she was able to provide the needs of the family.

Recently she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve her banana farm. She hopes to have a better life with her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Eufrocina

texts.en:
Eufrocina is married with three children.  She manages a general store to make a living. She has been doing this for ten years and she earns well for the family.

She joined GDMPC recently and had borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to improve her business in order to improve her income and plans to save a portion of her profit to use it for their future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Allan Jr.

texts.en:
Allan Jr. is studying for a BS in Criminology at Misamis University in Oroquieta City. He has a dream of having a job to earn money for his better future.

He is about to finish his course and now needs an intern uniform as their school requires . Without hesitation, Allan Jr. borrowed a new loan to pay for his uniform. He is hopeful to become successful in his future.

loans.use: to pay for intern uniform costs

loans.name: Herber Ulises

texts.es:
Herber de 49 años de edad, es una persona que solo estudio hasta noveno grado y es casado; su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa e hijos que van a la escuela,  quienes dependen de las actividades que él realiza.

Herber  se dedica a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres,  para llegar al terreno camina 3 Km.  y trabaja durante toda la mañana, mientras  su esposa durante la mañana ordeña y se dedica a  vender la leche y luego en el transcurso de la tarde, eé cuida los animales  en los potreros que alquila.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos vaca lecheras y producir mas leche para la venta y así obtener más ingresos para el sustento de su familia.

Él desea, comprar un terreno para construir su casa, ya que actualmente están alquilando lo que le genera mas costos.
texts.en:
Herber is 49 years old. He only studied until Grade 9. He is married, his wife takes care of the house. His wife and his children, who attend school, are dependent on him.

Herber works in agriculture an activity that his parents taught him. He gets up at 4 am and walks 3 kilometers to get to his fields. He works through the morning, while his wife milks the cows and sells the milk. In the afternoons he takes care of the animals in the fields they rent.

The loan Herber is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy two milk cows to produce more milk for sale and obtain more revenue to support his family. He wants to buy a plot of land to build a house as they presently rent and this generates more expenses.

loans.use: to buy two more milk cows to produce more milk to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Rice is one of the important food that our body needs.  Many entrepreneurs invest in this kind of job, and Fe is one of them.  She has a business buying and selling rice.  Because of the demand of her avid costumers, she wants to expand her business.  In fact, she has spent six years on this investment. 

Fe is one of the members of PMPC, since the year 2012 until currently, because of the loyalty given by the organization.  With it, she asks financial assistance from the institution amounting to PHP 10,000 for the purpose of purchasing rice stock.  This will help her to gain many costumers and keep her operation active.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in agriculture as his main source of income though he earns a monthly salary as his side income. 

He started this business to educate his children and sustain his family. He faces a challenge of climatic changes that affect his productivity. He has a vision of owning a big farm of bananas, maize, and rice in future.

Francis is requesting a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm for the next season.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm for the next season.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is married with four children, and she runs a general store for a living. She has been selling grocery goods for six years and she earns well for the family. Her husband also earns money from their farm, their main source of income. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more grocery goods to resell. In the future, Milagros wants to improve her business and hopes to create a better living situation for her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a single mom of two children and runs a general store to make a living. She has been doing this for three years and she earns well so that she was able to provide the needs of her children.

Recently she borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. Joan want to have a better living situation with her own family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with two children and manages her own retail store to make a living. Her husband is also earning from working as a driver. She has been selling grocery goods in their community for three years and she earns well for the family.

Recently she borrowed a new loan to purchase grocery goods to resell. She wants to improve her business and plans to use her profit as additional capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es: Rufino de 53 años de edad, se ha dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de ropa para Dama Caballero y niños, y gracias a Dios su negocio ha prosperado, el ya ha trabajado otros creditos en kiva y no cayo en mora, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva para la venta y asi seguir creciendo en su negocio, desde ya les desea una Feliz navidad y prospero año nuevo lleno de bendicion y gracias por ayudarlo a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rufino is 53 years old. For the past several years he has been selling clothing for men, woman and children. Thanks to God his business has prospered. He has taken out other loans with Kiva and has never fallen behind on his payments.

At this time Rufino is requesting a loan to buy new clothes to sell and continue to expand his business. He wishes everyone a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year, full of grace. He is grateful for the support to help him get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothes for re-sale.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson owns and operates a business venture selling fresh eggs in the local community to earn a living. Aside from this, he also operates his own farm of rice as their main source of income. He has been working on his farm for ten years, earning well for the family.

He used his previous loan from GDMPC in purchasing a vehicle to be used in the business and with his better income, Nelson had successfully repaid it. Recently he borrowed a new loan to purchase fertilizer and for weeding maintenance costs in order to improve his farm. In the future, Nelson hopes to help his children finish their studies and to double the income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and for weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Proeun

texts.en:
Proeun is a villager from Prasat Bakong district, Siem Reap province. She is 50 years of age and a married woman who has been blessed with two children. 

To make a living, Proeun has been engaged in the business of rice cultivation as her primary source of income. She also operates a recycling business to earn additional income for her family. Having been in the businesses for years, she is able to earn approximately $5.00 per day, which she usually uses to provide meals for her family.

She is borrowing this loan to build a safe latrine for the household as she used to have an unhygienic one before. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Proeun is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine for the household.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en: Rey is married with two children, and he helps his wife run a retail store to make a living. He has been in this business for six years, and it helps the family's finances. He also works part-time as a driver. Recently, Rey joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional grocery goods to resell and capital for a business buying and selling pigs. Rey wants to improve his investment and thereby improve his family's living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell and capital for a business buying and selling pigs.

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en: Rubie is married with three children, and he runs a general store selling goods in the market to make a living. He has been doing this for five years and earns well for the family. Recently, Rubie borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional grocery goods and vegetables to resell. He is hopeful to gain more returns from the business. He wants to have a better living for his family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is married and had three children. She runs a retail store to make a living. For being two years in the business, Vergie earns so well that she was able to provide the needs of her children. She always find ways in order to improve her business.

Recently she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. In the future, Vergie wants to have a better living situation with the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is married with two children and helps her husband operating their own farm for a living. She has been helping him for more than ten years and she earns well for the family.

Recently she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to replant bananas and for fertilization costs in order to improve the farm. With their farm, Wilma was able to earn money and support her children's education. In the future, Wilma wants to have a better life for the entire family.

loans.use: to replant bananas and for fertilization costs

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo is a man from Maribojoc, Bohol. He has been running a beauty salon in his area for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income. 

Arnulfo is requesting a loan to buy more materials for his beauty salon, such as scissors, hair blower, hair dye and other items. With this, he will be able to serve more customers in his salon. 

In the future, Arnulfo hopes to make his business a success, and aims to make it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more materials for his beauty salon such as scissors, hair blower, hair dye and other items

loans.name: Om-Fuad Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Fuad, and consists of five women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They have requested a group loan, and they will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment. 

Amal is the leader of this group. She is a 28-year-old married woman with a child. She is a very active woman. Amal is an uneducated woman from a poor family. 

Her husband is an immigrant and gets a small salary that is not enough to cover all the family's needs, so Amal decided to apply for a 50,000 YER (Yemen rials) loan from AMB to buy furniture and home appliances to improve the living conditions in her house. 

Taking this loan will allow her and her family to feel comfortable so they can enjoy living in their house. 

The extra two people who appear in the photo are group member's children.

loans.use: to buy furniture and home appliances to improve the living conditions in her house.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 33 years old and he lives in Berkaber village in the Tavush region. After coming back from the army, he got married and, together with his parents, became engaged in farming and agriculture in order to provide his family with good living conditions. Sometimes he also does some construction work and tries somehow to enlarge their family income.

On their farm he has 4 cows, 4 piglets and 20 chickens. Thanks to their agricultural activities, they manage to sell wheat, corn, figs and persimmons. They also sell milk and eggs. All the resellers buy right from their farm. Davit’s wife does not work and she takes care of their two children.

Davit asks for a loan of 650,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a cow and a lot of animal fodder (feed) that will be enough during winter months.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a lot of animal fodder

loans.name: Mihran

texts.en:
Mihran lives together with his mother, who doesn't work and takes care of the household. Mihran is the only breadwinner in the family and feels very responsible for being able to provide appropriate living conditions for his mother.

Mihran provides service from a small rented garage in the center of Kapan town. He is already well known among locals as a good quality service provider. The tools that Mihran uses in his work are too old. Because of daily costs, Mihran isn't able to purchase new tools with his own financial means, so he has applied to SEF for help. The loan of 600,000 AMD will greatly assist Mihran to purchase tools and materials for providing his vehicle repair service.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a great support for Mihran and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing vehicle repair service

loans.name: Mihran

texts.en:
Mihran lives in Kapan town with his wife and son. He has been involved in the renovation business for four years already. He is a well-known specialist in the region and his services are very in demand by locals. As the only breadwinner of the family, it is very difficult for Mihran to pay the family's daily costs and at the same time save money for investing in equipment and tools necessary for its services.

Mihran isn't able to purchase new equipment (a perforator). Mihran has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Mihran, as by purchasing the necessary equipment it will be easier for him to continue providing renovation services.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun and her husband are farmers. Farming is a traditional business for Lun and her husband. Lun lives a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has four sons and five daughters. Five of her children are married, one is a garment worker, one attends school, and one is still young. 

Another one of Lun’s sons is a motorcycle repairman. In addition, he also buys second-hand motorbikes to fix and sells them back. He recently opened the business with investment from his brother-in-law.

Anyway, he wants to run his business independently, but he does not have the money. Hence, Lun decided to apply for a loan for capital for her son. 

In the photo, Lun is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to help her son buy motorcycles to fix up and sell.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz Amparo tiene 69 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona que se dedica al cultivo de arroz, algodón, maíz, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de animales menores como patos, gallinas, cerdos entre otros, ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, Luz se dedica a esta labor para apoyar con los gastos familiares, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados que le permitirán generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Amparo is 69 years old. She lives together with her family in the district of Oyotún, a zone that is dedicated to the cultivation of rice, cotton, corn, business, and stockbreeding. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo which belong to the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

She makes a living selling small animals like ducks, chickens, and pigs, among others, which are located at the back of her home. She works in this business to help with the family expenses. She has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles to purchase balanced food that will allow her to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced food to fatten up her animals.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la comercialización de animales menores patos, gallinas y cerdos desde hace más de veinte años, Rosa se dedica a esta actividad para contribuir con los gastos familiares, ha solicitado un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de animales y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is fifty-one years old.  She lives together with her family in the district of Oyotún, where people make a living in agriculture, trade, and livestock.  This district is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.  

She makes a living buying and selling small animals, like ducks, chickens, and pigs.  She has been doing this for more than twenty years.  Rosa does this in order to contribute to the family expenses.

She has requested a loan of 700 soles in order to purchase animal feed to fatten her animals.  In this way, she will have a greater production to offer her clients, which will allow her to generate higher profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed in order to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim is 26 years of age and a single man who currently lives with his parents in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. Lim helps his parents earn income by working in the construction industry. As a paid laborer, he works 8 hours a day and is able to earn approximately KHR 20,000 per day.

At the moment, Lim is taking out a new loan from Kiva lenders to repair his house in order to improve his family's living situation. In the future, Lim wants to improve his skills in constructing buildings and aims to start providing this service himself one day.

loans.use: to repair his house in order to improve his family's living situation.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a married woman and a mother of five children from Antequera, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or convenience store business for several years now. 

Anastacia is in need of additional capital to buy additional merchandise such as snack foods, soap, shampoo and sodas to sell in her store. Through this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stocks thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Anastacia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise such as snack foods, soap, shampoo and sodas to sell in her store

loans.name: Ausberto Guzman

texts.es:
Ausberto tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona que se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedica a la venta de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, Ausberto ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ausberto is thirty-four years old.  He lives together with his son in the district of Oyotún.  The people here make a living in agriculture, trade, and livestock.  Oyotún is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo and is part of the Lamabyeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Together with his wife, he makes a living selling small animals in the back area of his home.  

Ausberto has requested a loan of 1,000 soles in order to buy animal feed to fatten his animals.  In this way, he will generate higher profits for his family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed in order to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Erlita

texts.es:
Erlita tiene 24 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza perfumes, talcos, cosméticos y cremas, sus clientes en la mayoría son mujeres, es conocida por el buen servicio y asesoramiento que brinda, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevo soles para comprar productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes cuando lo requieran, generando ingresos mayores para su familia.
texts.en:
Erlita is 24 years old. She lives with her husband in the district of Oyotún, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The population of Oyotún is involved in agriculture, commerce, and cattle.
Erlita makes her living selling beauty products such as perfumes, powders, cosmetics, and creams. The majority of her customers are women, and she is known for the good service and advice that she provides. 
She has requested a loan of 500 nuevo soles to buy beauty products so that she can have them in stock and therefore be able to offer them to her customers when they need them, generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to have in stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings for his farm for the next season.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a twenty-eight-year old single man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in the selling of first class and second hand clothes as his main source of income. He started this business to earn a living and look after his dependents. He has a number of challenges including competition, seasonal customers and inadequate capital to meet the high demands but has hopes of owning a big boutique for first class and second hand clothes. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more first class and second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more first class and second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yurdagül

texts.en:
Yurdagül sews for people in her neighborhood in an empty store she took over under her apartment. When she first learned about Maya, she bought herself a second-hand sewing machine as well as socks and underwear to sell in her shop. Thanks to her hard work, her business grew noticeably in a short time.  With her second loan from Maya, she improved the floor of her store and bought a second sewing machine. She has four children and her husband works as a laborer in another city. He has obtained his tax registration certificate as craftsman.  “Maya changed my life,” she said.  Her goal is to open a workshop and hire women who are in a tight spot.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Yurdagül Hanım evinin altındaki boş dukanda emanet aldığı dikiş makinasıyla mahalledeki komşularına dikiş dikiyordu.  Maya ile ilk tanışmasında kendisine 2.el dikiş makinası ve dükkanda satmak için çorap, çamaşır aldı.  Çalışkanlığının da yardımıyla kısa surede işlerinde gozle gorulur bır artış oldu.  Maya’dan aldığı 2. Krediyle dükkanının eski olan zeminini güzelleştirdi hatta 2.  Makinasını aldı.  4 cocuk annesi olan Yurdagül Hanım’ın eşi başka bir şehirde işçi olarak çalışıyor.  O artık vergi levhası olan bir esnaf.  Maya benim hayatımı değiştirdi diyor.  Hedefinde atolye açmak ve çıkış yolu bulamayan kadınlara yanında iş vermek var.

loans.use: to buy a second sewing machine.

loans.name: Carosi

texts.en:
Carosi is a thirty-two-year-old married man living in Kamwenge- Uganda. He deals in the selling of bread as his main source of income. He started this business to earn a living and look after his family. 

He has a number of challenges including competition, price changes and inadequate capital to meet the high demands but has hopes of building a permanent house out of his business.

He is requesting a loan to buy equipment to make different types of bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy equipment to make different types of bread to sell.

loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Thủy is 36 years old. She is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 3 dependents.

Thủy has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Thủy is requesting a loan to purchase materials such as sand, cement, and brick to build a new toilet. She and her family are using not hygienic latrines.

In 2004, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as sand, cement, and brick to build a new toilet. She and her family are using not hygienic latrines.

loans.name: Saly

texts.en:
Saly is 37 years old and a loving mother of three children who are attending school. Saly and her husband are working in the same career as local primary school teachers. From this career, they are able to earn a decent income to support their daily living costs and provide allowances for the children. 

As it is her first loan, Saly aims to invest in the purchase of a solar home system to install on the top roof of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. After this initial investment, Saly will be able to gain access to clean energy, which she will use to support household appliances such as light, TV, and radio, so everyone in her family can work or study even at night. She is very thankful and is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a solar home system.

loans.name: Amal Al-Hayah Group

texts.en:
Amal Al-Hayah is a four-member group. All the members of the group are poor ladies from Taiz, Yemen. Together they applied for a 200,000 YER loan from AMB.

Amal is a 24-year-old married woman who has some children. She is the leader of the group. She is uneducated and living in a poor area in Taiz. Her house is very old and in miserable condition. The house is vulnerable to fall down at any time. It is known that house renovation requires a lot of money. She has started renovating her house, but now she needs more money in order to complete the renovation. She asked for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy cement and bricks. She hopes that after the completion of her house renovation, she can start accumulating money to improve the living conditions of her family and open a savings account.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to complete the renovation of her house.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Historia De Vida.
Él es Oscar Javier  es un joven que  vive en la ciudad de Bogotá. es una persona trabajadora, responsable e inteligente entre mucha cualidades que tiene, vive con los padres y la hermana son una familia muy unida y llena de amor,  lo cual los a llevado a vivir experiencias muy bonitas en la vida. 
Oscar trabaja en un Call Center de servicio de comunicaciones,  lleva un mes en el nuevo empleo donde ha aprendido cosas que le aportan a la calidad de vida, también tiene diferentes hobbies,  practica el futbol, las matemáticas y la economía, es muy bueno con los números y le gusta tocar flauta.
Las metas es ser Docente de Matemáticas e Ingeniero Ambiental, en este momento no tiene los medios para pagar una educación superior, pero quiere estudiar Sistemas ya que es algo fundamental en la vida y la evolución de la tecnología.
texts.en:
Oscar is a young man who lives in the city of Bogotá.  Among all his other qualities, he is hardworking, responsible, and intelligent.  He lives with his parents and sister; they are full of love, and are a very united family.  They have had many beautiful life experiences together.  

Oscar works in a Call Center in communications services.  He has been working there for one month and has already learned things that have helped him to improve his quality of life.  He has many different hobbies, including practicing soccer, learning math, and studying the economy.  He is very good with numbers and also likes to play the flute.

His goals are to be a math teacher and environmental engineer.  At this time, he does not have a means to pay for higher education, although he wants to study Systems, which would help him in life and in understanding the evolution of technology.

loans.use: to pay semester registration fees.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 36-year-old married man with four children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is farming, alongside dealing in produce in order to boost his income. 

He is facing challenges of too much sunshine, limited customers, and pests and diseases. However, he has a vision of buying a motorcycle for transportation. Joseph has asked for a loan to buy pesticides and pay workers.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and pay workers.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe  SOUTOURA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 9ème  prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  AMINATA  fait la vente de chaussures  dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 20 paires de chaussures de marques différentes qu’elle revend en détail sur place et au marché. Elle vend au comptant avec une clientèle constituée d’homme et femme. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The seven members of Soutoura Group are married women who average 37 years of age and four children. Most of them live in traditional families in Sanoubougou I, a working class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

Eager to meet customer demand, the members of the group are seeking their ninth loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso.

Mrs. Aminata is the first woman on the left in the standing row in the photograph. She sells shoes and intends to use her loan to buy twenty pairs of shoes (various brands), that she retails for cash at the market of the city, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 45'000 (ca US$ 94), to be used in part to repay the loan and interests. The remainder will be put away.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles à  OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème  prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme   KADIA   fait la vente de pomme de terre  dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est en première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 5 sacs de pomme de terre auprès des producteurs qu’elle revend en detail sur place et au marché. Elle vend au comptant avec une clientèle constituée d’hommes et femmes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of Benkadi Group are married women who average 36 years of age and four children. Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, a working class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

Eager to meet customer demand, the members of the group are seeking their third loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso.

Mrs. Kadia is the first woman on the right in the photograph. She sells potatoes and intends to use her loan to buy five sacks of potatoes from producers. She retails for cash at the market of the city, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 30'000 (ca US$ 62), to be used in part to repay the loan and interests. The remainder will be put away.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Bethel Shg Group

texts.en:
These hard-working women have called themselves by the group name “Bethel”. They all live in Bishnupur which is in the state of Manipur, Northeastern region of India. They formed a group with an aim to generate income for themselves by accessing a loan. 

Rumunhoi is one of the six members of the group and is pictured with her hand raised. She is 33 years old and has one daughter. Her husband is in the army. Rumunhoi opened a 'pan' shop near the market area. With the loan amount she wishes to expand and refill the shop by buying varieties of chips in packets, cigarettes, and betel leaf/nut which are in demand. She believes that her shop will be a source of generating income for the family instead of her being fully dependent on her husband’s salary. Her daughter is studying in grade one, and she wishes to send her daughter to good schools in the future to receive quality education. 

Likewise, the rest of the group members also aspire to raise their economic, financial and living standards by generating more income. Some of the group members do chives cultivation, weaving or have 'pan' shops.

loans.use: To purchase more items like betel nut/leaf, cigarettes, bar soap, candies and many kinds of chips to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Toda la vida ha querido ser una profesional, siempre ha sido una persoan perseverante en lo que quiere.
Le gusta el estudio, para poder actuar en bien y poder explicar a los propios hijos que el estudio es muy importante para la vida de cada persona.
Dejo de estudiar cundo se vino para bogota, no puedo seguir por el modo de pago, ya que le tocaba pagar todo el semestre y ella no tenia la posibilidad de pagarlo a cuotas.
Desidio estudiar en campo alto, porque los estudios es algo importante para ella y quiere ser mejor cada dia, para darle elmejor ejemplo alos hijos.
En un futuro se ve como una gran enfermera, tratando a los pacientes con gran interes, porque una gran enfermera depende de los estudios y los pacientes, a si se ve, además en la familia tiene enfermeras, en al mente de ella esta ser una gran profesional para que los padres, hijos y demás se sientan orgullosos de ella como hija y mama, siendo una profesional y ellapiensa que en campo alto es una buena oportunidad para la vida de ella.
texts.en:
Claudia Patricia has wanted to be a professional her entire life; she has always been a very perseverant person when there is something she wants.

She likes to study, and wants to study in order to do her best and to be able to explain to her children that education is important in life for every person.

She stopped studying when she first came to Bogotá; she was unable to continue studying because she could not afford it.  She needs to be able to pay for an entire semester all at once; she does not have the option to pay her registration fees in installments.

She wants to study at a higher level because she believes that an education is very important, and she wants to make herself better every day in order to be a good example for her children.  

In the future, she wants to be a nurse, treating her patients with great interest.  She knows that becoming a great nurse is dependent upon her studies and her patience.  Other members of her family are nurses, and so she sees being a nurse as becoming a great professional; her parents, children, and other relatives will all feel proud of her.  She thinks that studying at a higher level is a good opportunity for her.

loans.use: to pay semester registration fees.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Эту молодую бизнес леди зовут Мухаббат, ей 28 лет. Она из Б.Гафуровского района города Худжанд. Мухаббат замужем, имеет шестилетнего сына и четырехлетнюю дочь. Ее муж находится в России на заработках. Мухаббат одна воспитывает детей и одновременно ведет свой маленький торговый бизнес. Она энергичная и успевает во всем. Мухаббат на рынке района имеет торговую точку, где занимается продажей женских платков. Она занимается этим бизнесом уже два года и научилась этому делу у своей подруги.
Чтобы увеличить товарооборот, Мухаббат обратилась за кредитом. Она собирается увеличить ассортимент платков в своей торговой точке и привлечь больше клиентов.
texts.en: Mukhabbat is a young businesswoman of 28. She is from Khundjand, B. Gafurovskii. She is married, and has a son, 6, and daughter, 14. Her husband is working abroad in Russia. At the same time she is raising the children by herself, Mukhabbat is running her own business. She is energetic and is successful at everything she does. Mukhabbat has a retail shop at the district market where she sell women’s dresses. She has been operating this business, which she learned from a friend, for more than two years. To increase her sales, Mukhabbat  has applied for a loan. She wants to increase the variety of dresses at her shop and and attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy women's dresses for increasing sales.

loans.name: Muhitavy

texts.en:
Muhitavy was born in 1959. She is married and has two children. Muhitavy has a medical education, and she has worked in a local hospital as a nurse for more than twenty years. Muhitavy has a small salary. Her husband is a bee keeper. 

Muhitavy must organize the wedding party of her daughter who wants to get married. Muhitavy has not enough money to do this, and that’s why she is asking for a loan of 3,000 Tajikistnian Somonis to organize a wedding party for her daughter. She looks forward to your support.

loans.use: To organize wedding party of her daughter

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a single Iraqi youth client who is 29 years old. He lives in his parents’ house and takes care of his mother and sister. 

Ali owns a small shop and sells women's clothing and cosmetics. He has excellent experience in this field, since he worked at several similar shops. In 2012, Ali established his own business and has earned an excellent reputation thanks to his very competitive prices. 

Ali is requesting a youth loan of $2,200. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 50 years old and he lives in the city of Kapan in the Syunik region. He is married and he has a son, who now is completing his military service in the army, and a daughter, who is school-aged. Samvel’s wife works as a deputy of the school director. 

Samvel is a skilled driver and for many years he has operated a private company, providing transportation in his own car. Samvel has one more car, which his friend drives as a taxi, and they divide the income from it.

Samvel is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to repair and buy winter car tires for his two cars.

loans.use: to repair and buy winter car tires for his two cars

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 51 years old and she lives in the city of Spitak in Lori region. She has two daughters: the elder is married and living with her family, and her younger daughter is a student at the Yerevan State Conservatory Musical Institute. Marine’s husband died several years ago, and since their children were small Marine had to endure many difficulties alone in order to provide her daughters with good living conditions. As a result of her great efforts, both of her daughters have received higher education. 

Marine works at the bank as a senior specialist. She lives alone, because her younger daughter who is a student lives in Yerevan in a rented flat. She is a very talented and clever girl. She simultaneously works at the choir.

Marine is asking for a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams in order to pay for her daughter’s postgraduate course and to buy some furniture for the rented flat where her daughter now lives.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s postgraduate course and to buy some furniture for the rented flat where her daughter lives

loans.name: Ivania Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Ivania es muy trabajadora, lucha a diario por salir adelante junto a su familia, es  madre de tres hijos en edad escolar, ella se dedica a vender bisuterías en su casa de habitación  así  como también  hace entrega a domicilio por encargos, su esposo trabaja  como albañil, de esta manera ambos comparten los gastos del hogar. Ivania solicita este crédito con el objetivo de comprar materiales de construcción con lo que instalara servicio higiénico y continuara parte del muro perimetral  de la parte posterior de su vivienda, lo cual es muy necesario por la delincuencia andando en su barrio, así le brindara a sus hijos seguridad y prosperidad en cuanto a las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Ivania is very hardworking. She fights every day to get ahead with her family. She is the mother of three school aged children. She works selling jewelry in her house and she also delivers orders to people's home. Her husband works as a bricklayer. Both of them share the household expenses. Ivania is asking for this loan with the purpose of buying construction materials to install a bathroom and continue building a part of the wall around the back part of the house. This is very necessary because of the crime in her neighborhood. This will give her children more security and prosperity for their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, iron, a toilet, PVC tubes and more.

loans.name: Na Mungu Tutaweza Group

texts.fr: La cliente Francine est une brave commerçante, présidente et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Na Mungu tutaweza », entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 25 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse d’habits (pagnes). Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché animé de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari de l’argent reçu de la tontine. Son conjoint, lui aussi, est commerçant. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 50 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The client, Francine, is a fearless businesswoman, the president and member of the "Na Mungu Tutaweza" business collective and a dynamic entrepreneur. She is a 25-year-old mother of four children, who are all currently receiving an education. This client sells clothing made from pagne. She shows off her wares at the busy town market. She started her business with her husband's assistance, using the money received from a savings group. Her spouse is also a retail trader. Later, she benefited from a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been running this business for four years. This new loan will allow her to buy 50 pieces of pagne cloth. With this loan, she wishes to increase her profits, to pay for her children's school fees and to feed them. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the work they do to liberate women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the established banking system, especially during this critical moment of conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 50 pieces of pagne cloth

loans.name: Irma Cristina

texts.es:
Irma se decidió por otro crédito para comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para preparar el terreno y cultivar sin ningún inconveniente. Así su cosecha de maíz será abundante y de calidad.
La inversión anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio, incrementar sus ganancias, cancelar puntual las cuotas y dar a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en: Irma decided to take out another loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and to pay for labor costs to prepare the soil and plant without any problems. This way, her corn crop will be abundant and of good quality. The previous investment helped her to fortify her business, increase her earnings, make her payments on time and give her family better food, clothing and health.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Xiomara Ines

texts.es: Xiomara es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco, de 29 años de edad. Casada y madre de un hijo. Se dedica al negocio de panadería. Inicio este negocio hace tres años, vendiendo poco pan en su barrio. Tiempo después su negocio iba creciendo. Hoy en día cuenta con una panadería estable y con una gran cantidad de clientela. Su meta próxima es asegurarle un futuro a su hija. Solicita un crédito para comprar: harina, huevos, azúcar, manteca, polvo para hornear entre otros, con el fin de realizar más pan y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será beneficioso ya que podrá aumentar su producción de pan y generarle mejores ingresos con la venta. Su plan futuro es apoyar a su hija en sus estudios.
texts.en: Xiomara is from the city of Boaco. She is 29 years old. She is married and the mother of one child. She works in the bread baking business. She started this business three years ago, selling a little bit of bread in her neighborhood. some time later, her business grew. Now she has a stable bread bakery and a lot of customers. Her next goal is to ensure her daughter's future.  She is asking for a loan to buy: flour, eggs, sugar, lard, baking powder and more, in order to make more bread and fill her customer's orders. She thinks the loan will be very beneficial for her since she can increase bread production and generate better income with the sales. Her plan for the future is to support her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, lard, baking powder and more.

loans.name: Hilary

texts.en:
Back in 2004, during one of Hilary and Corey’s horse riding sessions, a friend of theirs told them about Equine Assisted Therapy, which is the practice of using horses for emotional growth among mentally and physically disabled individuals. They knew right away that this would be the perfect business for them because it involved the two things they loved most – horses and helping others. This led them to start their business venture- Harnessing Hope.  

As successful business partners, who are also a married couple, Hilary and Corey have been providing Equine Assisted therapy, community activities and riding lessons to individuals with disabilities for over nine years in Chicago, which is their hometown. This past year, they moved their business to Georgia so they could provide their services to more individuals in a given year because of the more welcoming weather all year round. They operate out of a beautiful farm with stables, which they are renting. 

They are requesting the loan to grow their business and hope to use the money to purchase a used farm truck and to invest in marketing, sales, and upgrading their supplies.

Help this compassionate and animal loving couple to transform many more lives through alternative therapy.

loans.use: to purchase a used farm truck.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is 30 years old and he lives in the village of Dashtashem in Lori region. He is married and he has a 5-year-old daughter. He lives in a rented house with his wife and child. 

Sergey graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute with a degree in geography and economics. Now he is a director of the village school and at the same time he is a teacher of geography there. As he says the mission of being a teacher means to be responsible and careful, with rich knowledge to be able to educate younger generations. In the school he tries to organize interesting and informative competitions and games.

He is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and some professional literature to be more informed and aware of new methods and programs of teaching techniques.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature to be more informed and aware of new methods and programs of teaching techniques

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 72 years old, married, and has seven children. He lives in Fort Portal Uganda. He used his previous loan to plant onions, Irish potatoes, and maize and earned a profit from this project. He still faces the challenges of unpredictable weather changes, price fluctuations, and limited capital.

Amos is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy seeds for planting and other farm inputs. He has a vision of constructing a permanent home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a display window for his grocery store and to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married and has three children. Fares and his eldest son provide the family income together. 

Fares owns a small shop where he provides printing, faxing, and photocopying services to his neighborhood. He has been offering these services since 2004, and since then he has been gradually growing his client base and gaining popularity, since he is the only person with such a business in the surrounding area. 

Fares is asking for a loan of $2,000. He will use this loan to buy a new printer, and to increase his inventory. Fares is hoping to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he may provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a new printer and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 71-year-old married woman and the mother of grown children. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. She engages in tailoring services. She accepts dressmaking orders and repairs. She has been engaged in this business for more than ten years now. 

She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy zippers, cloth, buttons, sewing machine oil and thread. With these materials available, Elsa will be able to accept more orders for a better income. 

In the future, Elsa would like to expand her tailoring services in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy zippers, cloth, buttons, sewing machine oil and thread.

loans.name: Sirse

texts.es:
Sirse es una madre soltera de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación.
Desde hace 6 años está dedicándose a la confección a terceros y de línea propia, actividad que realiza diariamente desde las primeras horas de la mañana, cuenta con el apoyo de una empleada que contrata por horas, dependiendo del flujo de trabajo que tenga; así ha logrado generar ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares.
El crédito será utilizado en la compra de insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener material disponible para terminar la producción y entregarla al cliente de manera oportuna, logrando obtener buenos resultados en el margen de utilidades.
Sirse manifiesta que su propósito es fortalecer y acreditar mejor su negocio, logrando tener reconocimiento y estar en la capacidad de generar empleo a otras mujeres cabezas de hogar del sector donde reside, esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y de otras personas que influyen en la labor.
texts.en:
Sirse is a single mother with 3 children who she has brought up through hard work and determination. For 6 years she has earned a living sewing for third parties and also has her own line. She works every day from early in the morning and has the help of an employee who she hires by the hour, depending on the work flow she has. This is how she has managed to generate an income to cover the family expenses. 

The loan will be used to buy supplies wholesale (fabric, thread, buttons and other items). This will enable her to have materials available to finish the production process and hand items over to the customer in a timely fashion, getting good results in her profit margins.

Sirse says her goal is to strengthen and improve the profile of her business, gaining recognition and being able to provide employment for other mothers from her local area who have households to run. This will allow her to improve the living conditions for her own family and for other people who are involved in her work.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (fabric, thread, buttons and other items).

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is from Iraq. He is 49 years old, married, and has three children. Malek, along with his eldest child, provides the family’s monthly expenses while the other two children continue their studies. Malek owns a small shop where he sells plate glass, which is used for the installation of display windows. He not only sells these glass sheets, but also specializes in their installation. These glass sheets are highly demanded in the area. 

Malek has been in this field since 2008 and now he has three hired employees. His business has grown rapidly, because he is famous for this work and he has a lot of experience. Malek is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to install a rolling shutter to protect his shop and will increase his inventory of glass plates. With help from this loan, Malek aims to improve his business and increase his profits, so that he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter for his shop and to increase his inventory of glass plates

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2012 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers, since she has a business retailing rice.

Rosemarie  is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000. This loan is intended to purchase rice to stock and retail. Rosemarie dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her  business.

loans.use: To purchase rice to stock and sell

loans.name: Javier De Jesús

texts.es:
Javier, a sus 52 años de edad, se ha dedicado a fortalecer y acreditar poco a poco su negocio; una salsamentaría y licorera que inició hace 18 años, con unos ahorros que tenía y con la orientación de algunos amigos que se dedican a la misma actividad; su horario de trabajo es de 5 pm a 2 am y, genera un empleo para los fines de semana en los que se incrementa la clientela y sus ventas.
Su principal propósito es estructurar mejor su negocio, que cada vez genere mejor rentabilidad, para ello desea fortalecer su inventario de mecato, gaseosas, cervezas, cigarrillos, licor, entre  otros; con lo que tendrá más variedad para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes y así lograr los resultados que anhela ver, pues con la utilidades que su negocio genera, él puede brindar sustento y educación a sus 2 hijos, además podrá disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar en compañía de los que ama.
texts.en:
Javier, 52 years old, has dedicated himself to strengthening and establishing his business gradually: a butcher and liquor shop that he started 18 years ago with some savings he had and with the help of some friends who are dedicated to the same job. His working day is from 5PM to 2AM and he generates employment at the weekend when his customers and sales increase.

His main purpose is to structure his business better, which continues to generate better profits. For this, he wishes to strengthen his inventory of pastries, sodas, beers, cigarettes, liquor, among other things, with which he will have greater variety to satisfy the tastes of his customers and therefore achieve the results he wishes to see. So with the profit his business generates he can provide support and education to his two children. Additionally, he will be able to enjoy a greater quality of life and well-being in the company of those he loves.

loans.use: to buy pastries, sodas, beers, cigarettes, liquor, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of baby clothes, bed sheets, etc. to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients, like rice, palm-oil, maggi, salt, tomatoes, onions, etc. in bulk in order to stop buying this items at retail.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients in large quantity in order to cook a larger quantity of rice/sauce for sale.

loans.name: Go Try I Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Go Try I” group from Waterloo, a fast growing town in western Sierra Leone, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 7,200,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL). With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Elizabeth is the featured leader of this group. The fifty-two-year-old is married to a trader and they have four children. Elizabeth has been a businesswoman for eight years now. She sells clothes. With her share of this loan, she will buy the a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 59 years old and she lives in the city of Vanadzor in Lori region. She has four children: three of them are married and live separately with their families. Susan’s husband died many years ago. Now she lives with her youngest school-aged daughter and her retired mother, who is 93 years old and was a participant in the Great Patriotic War. 

Susan graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute with a degree in aesthetics, and she is currently a deputy director at the school. She is a very clever and wise woman, and she does her work with great care and responsibility. 

Susan is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and some literature about teaching methodology and techniques.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some literature about teaching methodology and techniques

loans.name: Mayram

texts.en:
Mayram is married and has three adult children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. She has a higher pedagogical degree and works in a local school as a teacher of Russian language, which she has been doing for more than 27 years. She has a great experience and is one of the best teachers.  

Mayram and her family live poorly. She is requesting a loan for 1,500 somoni, which she will use to buy a generator for winter.

loans.use: to purchase a generator for winter

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sticks at wholesale which he will then sell at retail.

loans.name: Artsrun

texts.en:
Artsrun, 21 years old, lives in Sevan in the Gegharkunik region. He is not married and lives with his parents and his sister. After coming back from the army, Artsrun established his own rather profitable business, selling a great range of stationery in a rented shop. The assortment of goods in his shop is great and perfect; he sells  notebooks, folders, pens, pencils, felt-tip pens, rulers, calculators, children’s fairy tale books, watercolors, special glues for papers and more, all sorted so neatly, so one can find and buy anything. Artsrun is a very cute and polite young man who never has a lack of customers, thanks to his pleasant attitude toward visitors to his shop. Artsrun's strong business skills bring about good sales, thus providing his family with high living conditions.

Artsrun is asking for a loan of 800,000 AMD to buy a new scanner and a new document copying machine since the last one is out of order.

loans.use: to buy a new document copying machine and a new scanner

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 58 years old and lives in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. In order to help the family, she operates a sari-sari store. In 2011, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with a good credit standing. 

She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 8,000 to purchase goods and basic commodities. 

She plans to send her children to college so that they can help her in the future, and to repair their house.

loans.use: to purchase goods and basic commodities.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, and married with two children. Saleh is the only income earner in his family. 

Saleh owns a shop where he sells oil for vehicle engines, and also provides an oil changing service. He is a very well known in the neighborhood, and has an excellent reputation in the surrounding area, thanks to his competitive prices. Saleh established his business in 2007, and now has an employee. 

Saleh is applying for a loan of 1,500 USD. He is planning to use this loan to install a sunshade for his workplace. Saleh wants to grow his business and increase his profits, so he may overcome his current financial difficulties, and provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: a sunshade for his workplace

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, tiene una familia compuesta por su esposa y sus dos hijos, es el pilar principal de su familia, genera sus ingresos realizando el cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol), es un oficio que aprendió de su padre y lo realiza desde muy joven.
Comprará abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas e insecticidas, para preparar el terreno en el que sembrara y tendrá una mejor cosecha. Espera tener una cosecha abundante, mejorar las ventas e incrementar sus ingresos para cancelar la deuda adquirida.
Sueña con darle a su familia mejores condiciones alimenticias y de vestuario.
texts.en:
Víctor has a family composed of his wife and their two children. Victor is the main pillar of their family. He generates income for his family by sowing basic crops like corn and beans. Victor learned this trade from his father when he was very young.

He will buy compost, fertilizer, pesticide, and insecticide to prepare his land for sowing and have a better crop. Victor hopes to see an abundant harvest, improve his sales and increase his earnings so that he can pay off the debt he is taking on. Victor dreams of giving his family better conditions regarding food and clothing.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, pesticide, and insecticide.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: Don Teodoro es originario de la ciudad de Boaco. De oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijoles, trigo y al ordeño de ganado, que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado salir adelante. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito ya que obtuvo una buena huerta de las semillas que siembra y seguir manteniendo sus cosechas. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar dos terneros para crianza, con el fin de obtener más ganado. Estima que el crédito le ayudara incrementar la crianza de su ganado y la reproducción del mismo.
texts.en:
Teodoro was born in the city of Boaco. He makes a living as a farmer, sowing corn, beans, wheat, as well as milking cows. He works very hard and has been successful enough to keep moving forward. Teodoro is grateful for Kiva and MiCredito, which helped him achieve good results in his garden from the seeds he sows. His previous loan helped him to maintain his crops. 

Teodoro is requesting a new loan in order to buy two calves to raise so that he has more cattle. He hopes that this loan will help him to raise more cattle as well as help them reproduce.

loans.use: to buy two calves to raise.

loans.name: Lungset Lom Group

texts.en:
Living her life as a refugee because of ethnic clashes since 1995, Hatneithem lives in a village which is about 45 kms from the main town of Imphal. The other group members also live in the same village. Hatneithem is the featured borrower member for the Lungset Group and she is pictured with her hand raised. Starting a new life after the ethnic clashes was not easy; financial insecurity paralysed their life. Her husband and she have geared up together to start a new beginning and work very hard, encouraging one another.

Hatneithem is a weaver. She weaves different designs of woven clothes for both women and men. At the beginning, she used to ask the customers to bring their own yarn/thread for weaving, and she usually gets paid for the labour charge only. She did not have the option to purchase yarns and thread for the customers as she did not have financial resources. After she joined the Lungset group, Hatneithem was able to purchase her choice of yarn and thread and makes more profit than before. The generated income is meager and is insufficient to manage the family expenses. 

With the Kiva loan, Hatneithem will purchase yarn and thread to stock and start weaving. With sufficient supply of yarns and thread, one can manage to weave, making woven clothes for both men and women, which is a very good source to generate income. Hatneithem is glad that, with the help of the loan, she will be able to continue the weaving business and also manage the family financial expenses with the generated income. Her only wish is to give good education to her kids so they will be able to stand on their own feet and become successful academically.

Hatneithem says “Thank you, Kiva!” The support and unending co-operation is hoped for and the group will also abide and practice the good message that Kiva is doing. The rest of the group members are engaged in piggery, cattle rearing, weaving and petty businesses.

loans.use: To purchase and stock yarn and thread for weaving

loans.name: Togouna Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe TOGOUNA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 8ème  prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  KOROTOUMOU  fait la vente de poisson  dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est assise à l’extrême  droite sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt une quantité importante de poisson auprès des pêcheurs qu’elle revend en détail sur place et au marché. Elle vend au comptant avec une clientèle constituée d’hommes et femmes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four member of the group TOGOUNA are married women, who average 46 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional families in SANOUBOUGOU I, a village in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are on their eighth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso out of concern for meeting the needs of their customers.

Ms. KOROTOUMOU sells fish in this group of women. She is sitting at the far right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase a significant amount of fish from fishermen. She resells the fish retail, locally and at the market. She accepts cash from a customer base composed of men and women. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used to repay the loan with interest, and the other part goes toward savings.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Fransisco

texts.es: El señor Francisco vive en la población de Entre Ríos con su hijo mayor, se dedica a la agricultura, en su propio terreno agrícola el cual adquirió hace años con mucho esfuerzo durante la colonización, actualmente está produciendo 2 hectáreas de yuca, 1 hectárea de cítricos y 1 hectárea de arroz, todos sus productos los comercializa a los intermediarios que compran donde se cosecha, es muy dedicado a su trabajo y cuando es necesario contrata personal eventual. Gracias a su esfuerzo continuo, logro comprar un terreno urbano pero como le falta recursos económicos, solicita un crédito para construir su propia casa donde podrá vivir cómodamente y lograra ofrecerle a su hijo mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco lives in the Entre Ríos settlement with his oldest son. He makes a living working in agriculture on his own land, which he acquired with a great deal of effort years ago during the agricultural colonisation. Currently he produces 2 hectares of cassava, 1 hectare of citrus fruits and 1 hectare of rice and sells all of his produce to intermediaries who buy directly at the point of harvest. He works very hard and hires casual workers when necessary.

Thanks to his continued hard work, he has managed to buy an urban plot but as he has insufficient funds he is asking for a loan to build his own house where he will be able to live in comfort and provide better living conditions for his son.

loans.use: to build his own house.

loans.name: Erico Libio

texts.es: El señor Érico de  32 años de edad vive con sus padres en Colomi, de estado civil soltero; la actividad económica que realiza es la agricultura, percibe dinero por la venta de papa y haba, cultivando en 1 Ha de terreno con rotación de cultivos,  los terrenos son herencia de sus padres. Es una persona humilde con escasos recursos económicos por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de calaminas para renovar el techo de su vivienda ya que el mismo se encuentra bastante deteriorado y en época de lluvia será un gran problema debido a las goteras, realizando esta refaccion lograra vivir de manera más cómoda y podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Érico, 32, lives with his parents in Colomi, and is single. The work he performs is farming. He receives money by selling potato and beans, cultivating 1 hectare of land with rotating crops. The land was inherited from his parents. He is a humble person with scarce economic resources so he is requesting a loan to buy corrugated metal sheets to renovate the roof of his house since it is quite deteriorated and during the rainy season it's a big problem due to the leaks. Making these repairs will mean he can live in a more comfortable manner and he will be able to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets to renovate the roof of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Blessings Group

texts.en:
Zainab, 27 years old, is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Mambolo, in northern Sierra Leone. Zainab is married to a school teacher and the couple has five children, four of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. For the past four years, Zainab has been selling clothes, dishes, etc. She will use her share of the loan (900,000 SLL) to expand her business, buying clothes and dishes in bulk to add to her current stock.

Together, members of this group are requesting a loan of 3,600,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes and dishes in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Money For Pay Group

texts.en:
Fatmata, 47 years old, is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Fatmata is married to a driver and the couple has four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Fatmata has been selling market food: onions, rice, fish, pepper, salt, margi (a sweet flavoring), etc. Fatmata will use her share of this loan (800,000 SLL) to buy these items wholesale to add to her current stock. 

With the help of this loan, Fatmata and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy onions, rice, fish, pepper, salt, margi, etc. wholesale to add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a toilet, fixtures, pipes, blocks, cement, sand, and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gari, sugar, salt, etc. in large quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Yesenia Yaneth

texts.es:
Yesenia, tiene la necesidad de invertir en el negocio de venta de huevos, y el capital lo utilizara para comprar huevos por mayor y luego distribuirlos entre sus clientes, a que sus demandas son mayores.
Con el préstamo anterior fortaleció el negocio, sus clientes aumentaron, las ventas son mayores y su economía es más estable, ella y su familia se encuentra bien de salud,
texts.en:
Yesenia needs to invest in the egg sales business, and she will use the capital to purchase eggs wholesale and then distribute them to her customers, from whom her orders are increasing. 

With the previous loan she strengthened her business and her customers increased.  Her sales are greater, her financial situation is more stable, and she and her family are in good health.

loans.use: to purchase eggs wholesale.

loans.name: Mirella Yvone

texts.es:
Mirella tiene 33 años, vive en la ciudad de chincha y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado tener su negocio de venta de abarrotes, bebida y comida desde hace 7 años, con lo cual ha podido sacar adelante a su menor hijo.

Mirella esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que nos han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para la campaña navideña como panetones, champagne, entre otros; así ella podrá atender el pedido de sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Mirella is 33 years old. She lives in the city of Chincha. With much effort she has been able to open her own business selling groceries, soft drinks, and other food items for the last seven years. This business has helped her provide for her young son. 

Mirella is grateful for Kiva lenders because the support she has received from them allows her to buy merchandise for the Christmas season such as breads, champagne, and other items. This will help her to meet the demands of her clients and increase her income. In this way, she will continue fighting to maker her dream of owning her own house a reality.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Cires

texts.en:
Cires is a 42-year-old lady from the Kisumu region which is found in the western part of Kenya.  She is a married woman who supports her family through the business.

She is selling second hand clothes, a business she has been doing for the last seven years and comfortably generates a monthly income of 16,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).  She is taking her fourth loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to increase her stock of clothes.  She plans to put her anticipated income back into the business.

Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of second hand clothes.

loans.name: María Del Sagrario

texts.es:
María es una mujer pujante y trabajadora, cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su ex esposo.
Actualmente se dedica a trabajar como empleada en una empresa de confección, en la jornada de 2 a 10 pm y, de manera alterna, tiene un pequeño taller ubicado en su casa, donde confecciona a terceros en la jornada de la mañana, cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana quien es la que tiene los contactos y le lleva la producción y de su madre, quien le colabora en la confección para terminar la producción a tiempo; de esta forma complementa los ingresos para dar sustento a su familia.
