loans.name: Wesam

texts.en: Wesam is 25 years old. He is living in a place in Jordan called Irbid with his family, consisting of seven siblings and his parents. Wesam is currently working as an accountant and at the same time studying for his Bachelor's majoring in the English Language. He is in his 2nd year and is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially as they are facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is one of the members of  Gathugu women's group.  She is a mother of four, and lives in the same compound with her mother-in-law and her co-wife with her two children. Gladys is employed in a tea factory on a six-month contract while her husband is a farmer in their 2-acre farm. Her family has been using the traditional kerosene for lighting and cooking for many years. Every month the three houses use approximately 12 liters of kerosene.  

After visiting their factory with a display of different solar lamps, Gladys was very impressed and decided to approach VEP for a credit to buy three solar packages that could serve her, her mother-in-law and her co-wife who would then assist her repay the loan. The solar package has the advantage of lighting four rooms, charging a mobile phone and powering a small radio. Her mother-in-law who has a two-roomed house would have her extra two bulbs lighting the compound, especially when they are needed to use the pit latrine at night.  The solar lamps will help Gladys save a lot of money used on kerosene for lighting, enhance their security by minimizing fire accidents, and improve their health by reducing eye and lung irritation from smoke.

In future Gladys also hopes to  buy an efficient charcoal cookstove that would help her switch from their kerosene stove to a cleaner charcoal stove.

loans.use: To pay for solar lanterns for her mother-in-law, her co-wife, and her home.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    SABALI   est constitué de  4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37ans et 4enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA  de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 11ème prêt. Les 10 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de KADIA qui est la 2éme femme   dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, diverses quantités de condiments  avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Sabali group is composed of four married women. On the average, they are 37 years old, with four children. They live in nuclear families in the Massablacoura district of the town of Bougouni. They know each other as neighbors and friends as well as through their business. In order to strengthen their financing capacity in order to improve their business, they have joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are now on the 11th loan. The ten prior loans have been duly repaid. The group members sell condiments, which is the case of Kadia, for example. She is the second one from right to left in the photo. She plans to use this loan to buy condiments in various quantities from the wholesalers in Bougoni. She sells at the market and out of her home, retail, for cash and on credit, to a mixed customer base. She plans to earn an average monthly income of 20,000 West African francs, which will be invested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Umaraly

texts.en:
Umaraly was born in 1986 in a village. He is married and has a child who is 7 years old. His wife is housewife. Umaraly has a plot of land where he grows wheat, peas, etc. He grows wheat and peas in his own land. His land has good conditions for growing vegetables and other crops because there is a good water system for watering the land. 

Umaraly’s business is only source of his family income. Umaraly is going to prepare the new season but he has not enough money. He is asking for a loan of 7500 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 48-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children.

For many years her son has been running a business of milk selling in his locality. Over time, he has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. He also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. He counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to his family's income. His business is good enough for him to lead a decent life. 

For the growth of his business, he wants to buy more milk to sell and for the production of cheese, butter etc. but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy more milk. Therefore, Abida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy more milk. 

He hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy more milk to sell and for the production of cheese and butter to sell in their shop.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 24 years old. He is living in a place in Jordan called Irbid with his family, consisting of three siblings and his parents. Mohammad is studying for his Bachelor's majoring in Sports Training. He is in his third year and is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially. They are facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees and to buy the stationery tools and books he needs for his study. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is 26 years old. She is single, living in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour with her parents and four sisters. 

Nada's family has been facing a financial crisis, which pushed her to start her own project of running a mini-market for the last six months, with a small amount of food products. Now she needs to add home products to her project to add variety to her products, as this will attract more customers and raise her income. 

But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To purchase more home products for her business

loans.name: 23 De Septiembre  (Manta) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Da Crédito 23 De Septiembre  se reúne cada 15 días en Las Cumbres en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace un tiempo  atrás y formar este Grupo de Crédito el cual les ha servido de mucho para aumentar sus negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades pero en su mayoría al comercio informal.
Don Manuel es socio de este grupo, tiene 61 años de edad, está divorciado pero de esa  relación tiene seis hijos  mayores de edad,  uno de sus hijos vive con él junto a su familia ya que el está comprometido y vive con la mujer y sus hijos pequeños.
Toda la vida el señor Manuel se ha dedicado a trabajar para que a su familia nunca le faltara nada, el se dedica a la venta de pescado, tiene un local arrendado en un mercado local en el cual trabaja todos los días desde hace más de 30 años, muy de madrugada el abre su local para recibir el mejor pescado que le llevan sus proveedores para luego vender a sus clientes, lo que más vende es el pescado por libras de picudo, albacora, bonito entre otros, sus clientes lo prefieren por que les despacha  el pescado fresco y con el peso correcto.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Este es su primer ciclo y espera que el crédito le ayude en su negocio, a él lo trajo su nuera que ya lleva más tiempo en el grupo, sus sueños son tener un local propio para no pagar arriendo.
texts.en:
Credit Group 23 de Septiembre (September 23) meets every 15 days in Las Cumbres in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches which people go to year-round, and also for its unparalleled beauty and many tourist attractions. These people decided to get together some time ago and formed this credit group which has been very helpful in growing their businesses. They do various kinds of work but almost all engage in informal commerce. 

Manuel is a member of this group.  He is 61 years old, divorced but has six grown children from that relationship. One of his children lives with him together with his family.  As he is engaged, his fiancee her small children live with them. Manuel has worked all his life so that his family would not lack for anything.  He sells fish and has a rented stand in a local market where he has worked every day for more than 30 years. He opens his stall at the crack of dawn to take delivery from his vendors of the best fish.  He then sells to his customers. He mostly sells fish by the pound such as bicuda, albacore tuna,  bonito, and others. His customers prefer to buy from him because his fish is fresh and he weighs it correctly.

This loan is to buy fish.  This is his first cycle and he hopes it will help his business.  His daughter-in-law brought him to the group as she has been with them longer.  His dreams are to have his own stall so he won't have to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Issakha

texts.fr: Issakha est un cultivateur âgé de 58 ans, il est marié et père de 15 enfants, il est établi dans le village de thilène, il a commencé à exercer cette activité depuis qu'il est petit, avec ce crédit, il va acheter du semence de tomate, d'onions, d'herbicide et d'engrais.
texts.en: Issakha is a farmer in the village of Thilene. He is 58 years old, married, and has 15 children. He started market gardening with his parents when he was little. With this loan, he will buy onion seeds, local eggplant, herbicide, and fertilizer.

loans.use: buy onion seeds, local eggplant, herbicide, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and other sundry items

loans.name: Oscar Elias

texts.es:
Oscar, solicita capital para poder cancelar el alquiler del terreno donde realizara su próxima siembra y continuar creciendo en su negocio para tener mejores ingresos.
Oscar Invirtió el crédito anterior en comprar los insumos agrícolas para sembrar granos básicos, lo que le ayudo a tener mejores ingresos, cosecha abundante, granos de calidad. En su familia hay un nuevo miembro.
texts.en:
With the support from this loan, Oscar plans to pay off the remaining rent balance on the land he currently farms. He hopes to continue tending his crops on what will soon be his own land and to increase his overall income and profits.

Oscar invested the funds from his previous loan in the purchase of the agricultural input items necessary to plant staple grains. This investment has helped him to strengthen his overall farming operation, leading to an abundant harvest and high quality crops. Since his last loan, his family has added a new child.

loans.use: to pay off the remaining rent balance and finally own the land he farms.

loans.name: Riadh

texts.en: Riadh, 24 years old, lives in Taiz, Yemen where he is an employee earning a low salary. He intends to improve his home, but lacks sufficient funds. Riadh has therefore applied for a loan of YER 60,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy house furniture. He hopes to establish a retail shop in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Josseline Yaneth

texts.es: Josseline tiene 20 años de edad y es madre soltera de un hijo de 4 años de edad. Ella trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma lleva la economía de su hogar y da a su hijo el sustento diario. Con mucho esfuerzo comenzó a construir su vivienda la cual todavía le hace falta algunos detalles como el baño y la cocina ya que para el resto ya tiene el material. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar los materiales que hacen falta como: lámina galvanizada, cemento, arena, grava y madera. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento para terminar su vivienda lo antes posible y poderse mudar junto con su hijo.
texts.en: Josseline is 20 years old and is the single mom of a four-year-old boy.  She has been working as a domestic employee for a long time and this is how she covers her household expenses and provides for her son. With great effort she has begun to build a house.  She still needs to build the bathroom and the kitchen but she has the materials for the rest of the house.  She is asking FUSAI for this loan so she can buy the materials she still needs such as: metal plates, cement, sand, gravel and wood.  She hopes to receive this financing so she can finish building her home as soon as possible and be able to move in with her son.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, cement, sand, gravel and wood to finish the bathroom and kitchen

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Álvaro, opta por solicitar nuevamente un préstamo para invertir en la compra plaguicidas, fertilizantes, abono, entre otros insumos agrícolas para sembrar y tener una buena cosecha.
Con la inversión anterior Álvaro aumento su producción, la cosecha estuvo libre de plagas y sus ganancias fueron mayores, en su familia todos se encuentra bien de salud y con un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Alvaro has opted for soliciting a loan anew to invest in purchasing plaguicides, fertilizers, and manure, among other agricultural inputs, in order to sow and cultivate a good crop.

With this investment, Alvaro will augment his production, harvest a crop that is free of plagues, and enjoy enhanced earnings. Everyone in his family is healthy and living a better style of life.

loans.use: to buy plaguicides, fertilizers, and manure, among other farming inputs.

loans.name: Rabee

texts.en:
Rabee is 22 years old. He is living in a sector of Jordan called Irbid with his five brothers and his parents. One of his brothers is in the military. 

Rabee works at a furniture store and, at the same time, studies for a diploma, majoring in space engineering. He is in his second year and he is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation, in order to start financially supporting his family since they are facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. 

For this reason, Rabee has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 57-year-old married man with eight children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He has rental properties and farms for additional income. For 20 years, he has managed to support his family using the income he earns from rentals. 

Abdallah faces the difficulty of limited capital to expand and maintain his business. 

He will use the loan to renovate and expand his rentals.

loans.use: to renovate and expand his rental properties.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 30 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad. Miguel trabaja como empleado pesando maíz y frijol en una tienda cercana a su localidad. Miguel desea mejorar su vivienda reparando el piso ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado y desea dar a su familia condiciones mas higiénicas. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo de piso, cemento y arena para proceder a las mejoras lo antes posible.
texts.en: Miguel is 30 years old and lives in his own house with his partner and two children ages 9 and 4. Miguel works as an employee weighing corn and beans in a nearby store in his community. Miguel wishes to improve his home, repairing the floor that today is deteriorating and he wishes to give his family cleaner living conditions. Thus he seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying floor brick, cement, and sand to proceed with the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy floor brick, cement, and sand to improve his home's floor.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De Santa Eulalia Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE SANTA EULALIA” se encuentran muy contentas por estar pasando el 02 ciclo ya que para ellas es una nueva experiencia trabajar en grupo. Luz cumple la función de presidenta en el grupo. Ella tiene 42 años es conviviente con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella tiene un negocio familiar el cual consiste en la compra y venta de de material reciclable botellas descartable papel fierro cobre bronce y aluminio. Ella se siente satisfecha ya que en la actualidad ha mejorado su negocio. Luz tiene como fin adquirir un depósito para guardar sus materiales reciclables. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de más material reciclable fierros aluminios y papeles. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Luz es la que viste chompa a rayas de color naranja amarillo y verde.
texts.en:
The members of the “Las Emprendedoras de Santa Eulalia” group are very happy to be going through the second loan cycle, since working in a group is a new experience for them.

Luz is the president of the group. She is 42 years old and she lives with her partner and her 3 dependent children. She has a family business which consists in buying and selling recyclable materials such as disposable bottles, paper, iron, copper, bronze, and aluminum. She feels satisfied because her business has now improved. 

Luz’s goal is to get a place where she can store her recyclables. She will invest the loan in the purchase of more recyclable materials such as iron, aluminum, and paper. 
 
The group thanks the Kiva lenders for the loan that they have given.  Luz is seen wearing the sweater with orange, yellow, and green stripes.

loans.use: to purchase more recyclable materials such as iron, paper and aluminum.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas is 19 years old and lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq. His family consists of seven siblings and his parents. 

Firas is studying to earn his bachelor's degree in finance. He is in his first year of school and is planning to find a job his study field after graduation. He wants to start financially supporting his family as they are facing a financial crisis. This crisis means that they are unable to help him pay for his upcoming semester fees. 

Firas has applied for this loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees since his family is unable to help.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Sina Group

texts.en:
Sina Group consists of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 260,000 YER. 

Sina is 41 years old, married, and has children. She plans to work very hard in order to provide a better life for her family. She makes a living selling women's fabrics which she has been doing for few years. Many people prefer to buy her goods because she is hard-working, positive, responsible, and honorable. 

She has always kept her business well-stocked which has allowed her many customers to visit and request products. Given that many people make requests and each one is for a new style, Sina is requesting a loan of 70,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to purchase a variety of new styles of fabrics, blouses, and skirts to stock her business. 

Sina hopes to increase her income which will in turn improve her and her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of new styles of fabrics, blouses, and skirts to stock her business.

loans.name: Nory Ester

texts.es:
Nory se caracteriza por ser una mujer pujante y emprendedora, madre de 3 hijos y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo.
Su tenacidad y el amor a sus hijos la han motivado para buscar alternativas que le permitan generar ingresos para sustentar las necesidades del hogar, ha trabajado como empleada durante varios años pero, hoy en día, tiene la posibilidad de iniciar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes para la cual ya posee el local y algunos activos fijos pero carece de surtido, por esta razón se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (mecato, granos, lácteos, carnes frías, azúcar, huevos, café, productos de aseo, entre otros), así podrá comenzar con su proyecto productivo, prestando un servicio a su comunidad y al mismo tiempo generará ingresos para sus gastos familiares.
Nory manifiesta que a pesar de las adversidades, siempre ha encontrado la forma de seguir adelante, por ello se siente con la energía para luchar por sus sueños, pues desea lograr acreditar su negocio para que sea sólido y rentable, que le permita tener una estabilidad financiera favorable que le permita brindar educación universitaria a sus hijos y verlos convertirse en profesionales idóneos y exitosos.
texts.en:
Nory is a strong, entrepreneurial woman and a single mother to her three children. Driven by her dedication and deep love for her kids, Nory has been motivated to search for alternative sources of income to provide for her family. She has worked other jobs under different bosses, but she now has the opportunity to become her own boss and open a general store. Though she has premises and several other pieces in place, Nory still needs merchandise to stock her store. 

With the support from this loan, Nory plans to purchase merchandise to stock her store for the very first time with the following products: dry grains, dairy products, frozen meats, sugar, eggs, coffee, toiletries, etc. She hopes this investment will pay off and allow her to open up a store that will not only help support her family but also benefit her neighbors and her community as a whole. Nory wants her store to be a dynamic, strong community business.

Nory has demonstrated over the course of her life that she can stay on her feet and continue moving forward despite adversity and hardship. Looking back at a difficult past, she has hope and energy to fight for her dreams and for a brighter future where her children have access to educational and professional opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk (dry grains, dairy products, frozen meats, sugar, eggs, coffee, toiletries, etc.) to stock her general store for the very first time.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es: La señora Dorotea es una persona mayor, pero es muy trabajadora y tiene ganas de superarse.Vive en una zona rural de Tiraque y tiene un  dependiente económico. La actividad que realiza es netamente agrícola y los principales productos que cultiva son papa, haba y oca, la siembra de estos cultivos lo realiza en sus propias parcelas que se hallan situados en su comunidad, como quiere superarse solicita un crédito para capital de operaciones para la compra de abono gallinaza y semilla de papa, de tal forma lograra obtener mayor producción y a través de eso podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Dorotea is an older woman, but is very hard-working and has the will to succeed. She lives in a rural area of Tiraque and has one dependent. She works purely in agriculture and her principle products are growing potato, bean, and oca. She plants the crops on her own land located in her community. As she wants to be successful she seeks a loan for capital in order to buy chicken manure and potato seed, so that she will be able to obtain a greater production and in this way she will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: buy chicken manure and potato seed.

loans.name: Dúo Kairos De Chimaltenango Group

texts.es:
DUO KAIROS DE CHIMALTENANGO
La señora María Etelvina de 41 años de edad,es casada,  desde hace 5 años fabrica servitas y teje güipiles,  ubicada en San Juan Comalapa, y que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de la señora María Etelvina es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE/KIVA; con el préstamo quiere comprar materia prima para tejer para seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
DUO KAIROS DE CHIMALTENANGO

Mrs. María Etelvina is 41 years old, married, and has worked for 5 years making clothing and weaving textiles. She is located in San Juan Comalapa and because of her efforts has been able to establish and improve he home. Through her business she has maintained and supported her family.

Her dream is to be able to improve the quality of life for herself and her family through the loan she is seeking from FAPE/KIVA; with the loan she wants to buy materials to weave in order to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Trabajando Unidos Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Trabajando Unidos” está conformada por 05 socias emprendedoras y responsables.  Este es el caso de Leonidas de 44 años casada con 04 hijos 02 de ellos en etapa escolar. Leonidas comenzó con brindando productos de primera necesidad con mucho pudo implementar su negocio. Actualmente también ofrece servicio de llamadas telefónicas. Se siente feliz pues cada día sigue  mejorando. El crédito que solicitó lo destinó para la compra de abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas. El anhelo de Leonidas es de seguir creciendo su negocio. El grupo “Trabajando Unidos” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Ella se encuentra de pie, es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo color morado.
texts.en: The communal bank “Trabajando Unidos” (Working Together) consists of 5 enterprising and responsible members. This is the case of Leonidas, who is 44 years old, married, with 4 children two of whom are school age. Leonidas began by providing basic need items as she started her business. Today she also offers services to make telephone calls. She is happy since every day she continues to improve. The loan she seeks will be used to buy groceries, beverages, and candy. Leonidas' goal is to continue growing her business. The group "Trabajando Unidos" is grateful to the Kiva investors for the help they provide and promise to continue working well. Leonidas is standing, the second person from the right side in a purple shirt.

loans.use: to buy groceries, beverages, and candy.

loans.name: Telmo Wilian

texts.es:
William tiene 43 años de edad estado civil unión libre vive con su esposa y sus hijos en el Cantón Urdaneta Provincia Los Ríos.

Es integrante de ventanilla Palmasola que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Palmasola, pertenece a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

William se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de gallinas. Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno para la siembra.  Las compras realizan en el  Cantón Ventanas en el Comercial  García. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para el cultivo para no arrendar. El desafío que enfrenta es  el trabajo contra la maleza. En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a la familia y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
William is 43 years old, married and lives with his wife and children in the Urdaneta canton of Los Ríos province.

William is a member of the Palmasola communal bank in the Palmasola area, which is part of the Ricaurte parish. In Urdaneta canton, people make a living doing agricultural work and raising livestock.

William works growing corn and raising animals. He is applying for this loan in order to pay the rent on the land where he sows his crops. William buys his supplies in the Ventanas canton in the García market. His dream is to buy a plot of land for his crops, instead of having to rent. One challenge that William is facing is dealing with weeds. In his spare time William likes to spend time with his family and play sports.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Patrick Olimi

texts.en:
Patrick Olimi is a 47-year-old married man with six children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is taxi transportation, alongside which he earns a salary from teaching and farming in order to boost his income. His main challenges include poor roads, which hinder his business, and fuel price fluctuation. 

Despite these challenges, Patrick has a vision of establishing a commercial farm and educating his children to tertiary levels. Patrick has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 26-year-old Palestinian refugee, married with one child. He was born in a Palestinian camp, just like most Palestinians living in Lebanon. His father died when he was very young, and his mother was the only person responsible for his upbringing. 

To help his mother in meeting their needs, Mohamad used to help his uncle on his mother's side in his business. His uncle had a mobile phone shop, so Mohamad gained valuable experience in this area and he decided to start his own business in 2008.

Mohamad's shop is located in the camp where he is living. This is an issue, because he cannot expand his customer base outside the people living in the camp. Mohamad is sure that, if he could develop his shop properly, he could attract customers from his competitors. 

Mohamad is therefore applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, so he can increase his business capital to improve and develop his business. He is planning to invest in newly released mobile phones and accessories, and mobile prepaid cards. In this way, Mohamad intends to respond faster to his customer's requirements, and to improve his family's socioeconomic situation.

Mohamad hopes to continue to provide his family with the best living standards possible, and he is looking forward to expanding his business in the future and to start wholesale trading if possible.

loans.use: to grow his mobile phone business with new models and accessories, and prepaid cards.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de servicio de taxi,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es comprar un carro nuevo.El socio soliicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio esta contento con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos continues his work as a taxi driver, and he works from 8:00 every morning until 10:00 every night. He hopes that his hard work and dedication will help him to get ahead and eventually realize his dream of buying a new car.

With the support from this loan, Juan Carlos plans to purchase tires for his taxi. He hopes this investment will help him to improve the quality of service he offers his clients, and he promises to make all scheduled loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Dúo Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Dúo Esperanza, 
Este dúo está conformado por  Gabriel de 31 años,  el se dedica  a la confección de  sobre fundas,  manteles y cubrecamas, pantalones, camisas etc. El solicita el crédito para comprar telas, las cuales utilizará  para la confecciones de pantalones escolares, el aprovechará que en el mes de enero inicia nuevamente el ciclo escolar, ya que cuenta con clientes que lo conocen el desea cubrir la demanda de pedido que tenga para los próximos días.
texts.en:
Dúo Esperanza,

Gabriel is 31 years old and makes items such as pillowcases, tablecloths, bed covers, pants, shirts, etc. He seeks a loan to buy fabric which he will use to make school pants. He will take advantage of January being the month that starts the new school years, as he has customers who know him and he wishes to meet the demand that he will have in the upcoming days.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing items.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gadys de 45 años de edad  tiene una tienda donde vende víveres, ranchos, etc hace 10 años, negocio que inició impulsada por la necesidad de generar ingresos aprovechando que contaba con un sitio muy comercial. En su negocio vende diariamente a campesinos del municipio,   artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, carnes, lácteos, enlatados, embutidos, refrescos etc,  Su meta es lograr diversificar cada vez mas y tener un inventarios suficiente para ofrecer y atraer a su clientela, generar mas ingresos para apoyar la educación de sus hijos que se encuentran en las edades de 16, 21 y 23 años. Un día laboral de Gladys inicia a las 4 de la mañana, porque su venta es directamente al consumidor, que compra desde muy temprano,  en cantidades que ellos requieran para du consumo diario. En la actualidad  Gladys está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará azúcar, aceite, y en general artículos de primera necesidad, de los que más rotan en su tienda. Gladys trabaja  sin cesar con el fin de lograr metas de ahorro que convengan a la solución de sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Gladys, 45 years old, has a store where she has sold food, snacks, etc. for 10 years.  She started this business driven by the need to generate income making use of the fact that she has a very commercial spot.  In the business she sells daily to farmers from the municipality, items that are basic staples like rice, sugar, meats, dairy products, canned goods, lunch meats, soft drinks, etc.  Her goal is to diversify more and more, to have sufficient inventory to offer, to attract her clientele, to generate more income to support her children, who are ages 16, 21 and 23, in their education.  Gladys’s workday begins at 4:00 in the morning because she sells directly to the consumer who is buying very early in the morning and in the quantities that they need for their daily consumption.  

Currently Gladys is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase sugar, oil and in general items that are basic staples, those that rotate through her store the most.  Gladys works nonstop with the aim of achieving the goal of saving what would suit their needs.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, oil and items that are generally basic staples.

loans.name: Rebenia

texts.en:
Rebenia is a married woman and a mother of six children from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a hog-raising business.

Rebenia is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. Through this, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 33-year-old single mother of three children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

She sells secondhand shoes. She started this business with the aim of educating her children after losing her husband. She used the previous loan to buy shoes to sell. 

Being a single parent, she is responsible for providing for her family, but she has the challenge of limited capital. She intends to educate her children and buy a plot in town. 

Annet is requesting a loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Saira Tomasa

texts.es:
Saira, se dispone en invertir en el negocio por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo con el que comprara ropa para bebe, sandalias, camisas, granos básico, especias, carnes, aceite, entre otros ingredientes para la venta de antojitos y comida.
Con el capital anterior ella invirtió en la compra de materia prima para la venta de antojitos, le ayudo a mejorar su economía y crecer en su negocio, hoy en día también ha implementado la venta de ropa y calzado, con los que obtiene ingresos extras.
texts.en:
With the support from this loan, Saira plans to purchase food (dry grains, spices, meat, oil, etc.) and clothing (shirts, sandals, baby clothing, etc.) to support her two businesses, food preparation and sales and clothing sales. 

Saira leveraged the funds from her previous loan to support her food preparation and sales business. With that investment, she was able to strengthen and expand her business and improve her overall financial situation. She has recently expanded her business endeavors to include clothing and shoe sales in hopes of generating additional income.

loans.use: to purchase food (dry grains, spices, meat, oil, etc.) and clothing (shirts, sandals, baby clothing, etc.) to support her two businesses.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business manufacturing garlands for the past ten years. 

She offers various garlands for brides and grooms. She sells them to the people of her community and also supplies them in the local market. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy raw material such as strings, cutters, shining papers and artificial flowers in various colors. It will help her to inflate her sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as strings, cutters, shining papers and artificial flowers in various colors.

loans.name: Cathbert

texts.en:
Cathbert is a thirty-five-year-old married man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and develop himself. He has been in the business of selling alcohol (beers and spirits) for eight years, and his main hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. He has a vision of educating his children, moving his business to a more permanent location and expanding his business to new markets. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more crates of beers, sodas and spirits to sell.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beers, sodas and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is 24 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour with his parents and five siblings. 

His family has been facing a financial crisis which pushed him to start his own business to support them. He opened his own barbershop one year ago after earning experience working at another barbershop.

Now, he needs to expand his business. He wants to buy shaving tools and cosmetic products in addition to wanting to decorate his shop. These items will make his work easier, will attract more customers, and will increase his profits. 

Walid doesn’t have enough money to buy these items to improve his business, so he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy shaving tools and cosmetics for his barbershop

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 21-year-old single man. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen.  He is an employee in the government sector getting a low salary, which is barely enough to cover his family's needs. 

He is applying for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase a laptop. He aspires to buy a house to live in with his family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop.

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is a 21-year-old woman who lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her five siblings and her parents. She is studying for her Bachelors degree, majoring in Sport Training and Management. She is in her third year. 

Haneen is close to graduation, and is planning to work in her field of study afterwards, to start helping her family financially. They are currently facing a financial crisis, which means that they are not able to help pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children.

Her husband provides whitewashing and oil painting services to his customers in the community. He paints walls, doors and windows. He wants to continue his service but with the passage of time his tools have been wearing out. However due to lack of availability of funds it seems impossible to buy new tools to continue his services. 

Therefore, Mumtaz has requested a loan so her husband would be able to buy multi-colored cans of paint, brushes, rollers, kerosene oil etc. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tools, cans of paints and oil for whitewashing services.

loans.name: Suriyya

texts.en: Suriyya is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a wood sale business for many years.  She sells wood to the people of her community, as they use it to make the handles of knives and furniture and also use for burning purposes.  Over time, Suriyya has become famous in her area for providing good quality wood of different types. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to the family income.  Suriyya is requesting a loan of PKR 55,000 from the Kashf Foundation to purchase bundles of good quality wood and some cutters. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of good quality wood and some cutters.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in the selling of second hand clothes as her main source of income. She started this business to earn a living and look after her family. She faces a number of challenges including competition, seasonal customers and inadequate capital to meet the high demand but has hopes that in future she will own a big boutique of second hand clothes.

She is requesting a loan to buy more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She is a mother of a three-year-old baby boy. She operates a fish-vending business. Evelyn has been in the business for several years now. 

Evelyn has requested a loan to buy more fresh fish to resell in order to augment her income. In the future, Evelyn hopes to make her fish-vending business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her son.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to resell.

loans.name: Cristo Rey De Nicolas De Pierola Group

texts.es: “CRISTO REY DE NICOLAS DE PIEROLA”  está conformada por socias trabajadoras y muy responsables en sus cuotas. Luisa tiene 59 años es casada con un hijo educando en la universidad y un pequeño nieto a quien apoya económicamente. Luisa se dedica a la costura desde muy joven y además de haber sido maestra de corte y confección. En la actualidad cuenta con puesto en donde hace arreglos y cose ha pedido de sus clientes.   El préstamo lo invertirá  en la remodelación de puesto de trabajo y algunos accesorios que le falta para su taller. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado.  Luisa es la persona más alta del grupo viste chompa negra.
texts.en:
The “Cristo Rey De Nicolas De Pierola” group is made up of hard working members who are very responsible with their payments.

Luisa is 59 years old and married, with a son who attends the university, and a little grandson whom she supports financially.  Luisa has worked in sewing since she was very young, in addition to having been a teacher of dressmaking. 

Currently she works doing mending and sewing at the request of her customers.  She will invest the loan in remodeling her work place and in some accessories that she needs for her workshop. 

The group thanks the Kiva lenders for the loan that they have given. Luisa is the tallest person in the group and she is seen wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to remodel her workshop.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is the mother of a nine-year-old child. She operates a plastic supplies store. She sells various items like cellophane, native brooms, pots and plastic ropes. This is the source of her income.

Mary Jane is asking for a loan to buy more stock like various kinds of cellophane, chlorine and other products, to attract more customers. With this, she will be able to sell more thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock like various kinds of cellophane, chlorine and other products.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has five years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing a stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small business manufacturing hair bands in her community for the last three years with the support of her husband. She offers various types of hair bands in different colors. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is the mother of two and is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy a stock of elastics, threads of different colors along with packs of beads for embellishment. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of elastics, threads of different colors along with packs of beads.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a reserved woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. 

Suzan was born in 1992. She is living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Madaba with her husband, who works at a hotel. Suzan noticed that they are facing financial crisis. She started running a business selling shoes one month ago with her husband's help, and they are now running their own showroom. 

Suzan would now like to buy more shoes so she can make a larger profit, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for her business

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en: Gertrudes is a 44-year-old married woman  from Talibon, Bohol.  She has three young children. The youngest child is 13.  She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business selling various goods and items such as canned goods, candies, chips, seasoning, shampoo and condiments to the people in her place.  Her business started almost five years ago.  Her husband works as a farmer and Gertrudes is motivated to help him by working hard to improve her business.  She is asking for a loan to buy  two sacks of rice, canned goods and toiletries. It is her dream to continue working for the expansion of her store, so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice, canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia, age 46,  is a married woman and mother of four children.  Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.  For this reason, Safia has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wool in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 58 años de edad habita en casa propia desde hace mucho tiempo. Rosa es un mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. Ella se gana la vida mediante la comercialización de verduras. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante en su comunidad. Rosa solicita este este crédito para invertir en la construcción de un baño ya que como se puede observar en la fotografía lo tiene cubierto de plástico lo cual no es muy seguro. Con el crédito comprará lámina y madera. Además, desea instalar el servicio de la energía eléctrica ya que no cuenta con el servicio.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 58, has lived in her own house for a long time.  Rosa is a very hard-working and responsible woman.  She earns a living selling vegetables in an itinerant manner in her community.

Rosa is requesting this loan to build a bathroom.  As can be seen in the photograph, she has it covered in plastic, which is not very secure.  She will use the loan to buy metal sheeting and wood.  Also, she wishes to install electrical service because she does not have this service.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and wood and to install electrical service.

loans.name: Atef

texts.en:
Atef is 32 years old. He lives in Gaza with his wife and two children. He sells various kinds of foodstuffs, such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni and many other items, in his grocery store. He opened it three years ago.

Atef is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a display refrigerator and shelves. This will allow him to be able to increase his stock. 

He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. His dream is to expand his business, and he desires to use part of the profits on his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a display refrigerator and shelves, which will allow him to be able to increase his stock.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is a married man and a father of three children, ages 3, 10, and 11. 

Alejandro has been engaged in a hog-raising business for several years now. He has been raising pigs for almost three years. 

Alejandro is asking for a loan to buy more pigs to raise and to buy animal feed. Through this loan, he will be able to grow healthy pigs, which he can then sell. 

In the future, Alejandro hopes of making his business a success and a sustainable source of his income.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Nsuura 1 Savings And Credit Group

texts.en:
Alfred is a member of the 'Nsuura 1 Savings & Credit Group'. He is a hard working man, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is selling fresh foods and produce, and he also works as a farmer in order to boost his income. The main challenges that Alfred faces are price fluctuation, and low demands for his products. 

Despite these issues, Alfred has a vision of expanding his business and educating his children. Alfred has asked for a loan to buy more stocks of produce for resale. He is a member of this group where each member holds each other accountable for loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of produce for resale.

loans.name: Joint Effort For Rural Dev't Group

texts.en:
Jane is a member of the 'Joint Effort for Rural Development Group'. She is a hardworking lady living in Fort Portal,Uganda. Her main business is farming and crop growing, alongside running a retail shop in order to boost her income. Jane is facing challenges of limited capital and seasonal changes; however, she has a vision of educating her children to higher levels. 

Jane has applied for a loan to buy garlic and onions for growing. She is in a group whereby each member guarantees the other to repay their loan.

loans.use: to buy garlic and onions for growing.

loans.name: Amira

texts.es: Amira de 59 años de edad habita en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Cartagena, lugar donde tiene su expendio de carne de res, desde hace 34 años, cuando aprendió de su madre quien también se dedicó a este oficio. Amira realiza sus ventas en un 80% de contado y el 20% restante a crédito, directamente entre expendios cercanos, vecinos y a restaurantes, ubicados alrededor del sector donde se encuentra su negocio. Las fincas de la zona donde habita son sus principales proveedores, que ofrecen productos frescos y de buena calidad. Amira tiene como meta hacer adecuaciones locativas a su negocio, para lo cual requiere efectivo disponible diferente de su capital de trabajo, por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará materiales de construcción para dar una presentación adecuada a la venta de alimentos a su local. Con esta inversión mejorará la imagen de su local, impactando la vista de su clientela y con ello logrará atraerlos, para a futuro lograr ahorrar, mejorar sus ingresos y con ello su vivienda.
texts.en: Amira is 59 and lives in a town near to the city of Cartagena, where she has had her meat store for 34 years.  She learnt the trade from her mother, who also did this job. Amira handles her sales, which are 80% in cash and the remaining 20% on credit, directly to nearby shops, neighbours and restaurants near to her business. The farms of the area where she lives are her main suppliers and they offer fresh, good-quality products. Amira's goal is to make repairs to her business, for which she needs available cash that is separate from her working capital. For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan, which is her first finance arrangement with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan she will buy construction material to be able to present her food goods better in her business. The loan will improve her business' image, impacting her customers and attracting them, so that in the future she will be able to save, improve her income and with that her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Pedro Eduardo

texts.es:
Pedro  tiene  43 años de edad estado civil unión libre vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 16, 13 y 9 años  en el Cantón  Urdaneta  Provincia Los Ríos.

Es integrante de ventanilla Palmasola que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Palmasola, pertenece a la parroquia Ricaurte al Cantón Urdaneta se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maíz. Solicita el crédito para la siembra de arroz, maíz y lo necesario en la agricultura como la semilla y los abonos.  Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de Ventanas. El sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Los desafíos que se enfrenta es presencia de mucha lluvia. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear en el pueblo y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Pedro is 43 years old and lives with his wife and their three children, ages 16, 13 and 9, in the town of Urdaneta in the province of Los Ríos. Pedro makes a living tending livestock and farming rice and corn, and he is a member of the Palmasola cooperative, which is part of the Ricuarte parish, also located in Urdaneta.

With the support from this loan, Pedro plans to purchase agricultural input items for planting and tending his crops, including seeds, fertilizer and manure. He makes purchases for his business in the city of Ventanas, and one of the main challenges he faces in his farming efforts is heavy rain. In his free time, Pedro likes to walk around town and play sports. His dream is to improve his quality of life and provide all he can for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for planting and tending his crops.

loans.name: Maqbool

texts.en:
Maqbool is a 47-year-old married woman, living along with her eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing.

Her husband performs his all duties regarding milk selling very well. He uses a part of the unsold milk for making yogurt, butter, cheese, and for his family usage. He has a few heads of cattle that provide him with milk, which he sells to earn money. 

He needs the loan to buy milk, a bucket, and an equilibrium weighing machine for his milk selling business. His weights and equilibrium have been wearing out.  

Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy a bucket, an equilibrium weighing machine and additional milk for selling.

Maqbool hopes this loan will bring positive changes in the lives of her beloved family members. 

Maqbool thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy additional milk, a bucket, and an equilibrium weighing machine for her husband's milk selling business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes does farming in Kangundo town where she grows cash crops such as maize, beans and vegetables. She is 57 years old and married. Together with her spouse they have been blessed with five children. She has been in this business for the past four years and she makes a monthly income of KES 30,000. Her spouse also provides additional income.

She plans to use this loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and manure for use in her farm and thereby get more produce. She will use the anticipated income to improve her farming.

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid back her previous loans successfully. In future Agnes hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is a fish vendor. Her husband is a fisherman. They live in Talibon, Bohol, and have three children, ages five, six, and nine. This is the source of their income.

Ma. Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy nets for fishing and lead weights, hooks and buckets for storage. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell. In the future, Ma. Lourdes hopes to make their business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy nets for fishing, and lead weights, hooks and buckets for storage

loans.name: Prosperidad  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Prosperidad está conformado por 9 socias y 1 socio, cada uno de ellos aporta activamente al grupo con sus buenos ánimos, gran carisma y la solidaridad, todos se encuentran unidos hace varios años, tiempo que ha estableció que este grupo sea más que una familia, su objetivo principal es el mejorar su estabilidad económica y que sus familias llegue a tener más oportunidades de superación. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de una belleza natural y arquitectónica, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, es cuna de grandes deportistas y escritores.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ana, es la presidenta del grupo de crédito Prosperidad, es socia de este grupo desde hace algunos años.
La Señora. Ana tiene 62 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos mayores de edad que son casados y viven independientes. Su esposo le ayuda en casa ya que es jubilado, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Ana se dedica a la elaboración de ropa deportiva y lencería, esta actividad la aprendió desde que se caso ya que su suegra le dejo como herencia este trabajo, le gusta mucho ya que esta actividad le da la oportunidad de pasar en casa al cuidado de sus hijos y ser independiente económicamente.
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en telas e hilos, está solicitando un nuevo crédito ya que necesita  comprar repuestos para sus maquinas de coser, telas e hilos. Su meta es  continuar creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Credito Prosperidad” loan group is made up of nine ladies and one gentleman, each of them actively works with the group and presents his or her enthusiasm, charisma, and unity.  They have been together for several years and this group has established itself as a group that is more than a family.  Its main objective is to improve financial stability and for their families so that they can have the opportunities to succeed.  They live in the city of Cuenca, which enjoys a natural and architectural beauty.  It has been a World Heritage Site since 1999 and is the crib for great athletes and writers. 

Ana is one of the members and has served as president of the “Credito Prosperidad” group for several years.

Ana is 62 years old, married, and has four adult children, who are all married and live on their own.  Her husband helps her in the home because he is retired.  They own their home.

Ana makes sportswear and lingerie.  She began learning this when she got married, since her mother in law left her this business.  She likes it very much because it allows her to stay home caring for her children, while being financially independent.  She used the money from the previous loan to buy fabric and thread.  She is asking for a new loan to buy spare parts for her sewing machines, fabric, and threads.  Her goal is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Leonardo Gustavo

texts.es: El señor Leonardo es una persona humilde y trabajadora, curso hasta la primaria y por cuestiones económicas no prosiguió con sus estudios superiores, es por eso que desde muy joven se vio en la necesidad de buscar trabajo y dejo de lado los estudios, lleva elaborando sus productos por más de 4 años hoy solicita un crédito con el fin de comprar termos contraíbles para poder envasar los productos que tiene en almacén, de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de sus productos y lograra obtener más ingresos para su beneficio y el de su familia.
texts.en: Leonardo is a humble and hardworking person.  He has an elementary school education and was not able to continue due to financial issues.  Instead he had to go to work at an early age.  He has been making his products for more than four years and he is asking for a loan to buy vacuum bottles so he can bottle up the products he has stored up.  In this way he will be able to improve the quality of his products and increase his income to benefit himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid  de 27 años, madre de un niño de 3 años de edad, se dedica a la actividad comercial; ella vende productos naturales y mercancía variada como  cosméticos y accesorios femeninos,  mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos. Sus principales clientes pertenecen a la congregación de la iglesia donde practica su culto, a quienes vende de contado y a crédito, desde los jueves hasta los domingos. Su meta es lograr impactar sus ingresos logrando vender mucho mas, para continuar estudiando  y ofrecerle una educación de calidad a su pequeño hijo. Su mayor desafío es lograr ahorros suficientes, resultado de su trabajo persistente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará  productos de belleza  y naturales que han encargado sus clientes; con ello inicia su meta de incrementar sus ingresos, para avanzar en el crecimiento de su negocio
texts.en:
Ingrid is 27 years old and is a single mother to her 3-year-old son. She makes a living selling health and beauty products from catalogs, and many of her clients are members of the church she attends. For their convenience, Ingrid offers her clients cash or credit payment plans, and she works every Thursday through Sunday. Her goal is to increase sales and her overall income so that she can continue studying and eventually give her son access to a high quality education. The biggest challenge she faces is building up savings, since sales can be inconsistent and undependable.

With the support from this, her very first loan, Ingrid plans to purchase health and beauty merchandise to stock her business and offer a greater variety of products to her clients. She hopes this investment will help her to strengthen and expand her business and provide for her young son.

loans.use: to purchase health and beauty products to stock her business.

loans.name: La Florida  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito La Florida está formado por 5 socias y 1 socio quienes laboran en diferentes actividades las que le permiten mejorar su estabilidad económica y cumplir sus metas, los créditos les permiten mejorar sus negocios y así crecer poco a poco, son personas que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que se encuentra rodeada de montañas por su geografía accidentada, cuenta con varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza y esta bañada por 4 ríos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ruth, es una socia activa que forma parte del grupo de crédito La Florida, grupo al que pertenece desde hace 2 años, en todo este tiempo ha llegado a tener una muy buen amistad con todas sus compañeras, los créditos le gustan ya que le benefician para el crecimiento de sus negocios.
La Señora Ruth tiene 50 años de edad, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos mayores de edad, están casados y uno de ellos vive independiente,  una hija casada vive en su casa con quien comparte los gastos, su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Ruth se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y cuida de sus nietos, para tener su independencia económica se dedica al negocio de comidas, trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de víveres para la preparación de sus productos. Su meta es crecer más en el negocio.
texts.en:
The “La Florida” lending group is made up of five ladies and one gentleman with different businesses which allow them to improve their financial stability and reach their goals.  The loans allow them to improve their businesses and grow little by little.  They are people who keep their traditions and culture.  They live in Cuenca, a city surrounded by mountains because of its accidental geography.  There are several places from where to enjoy nature and it is bathed by four rivers.

Ruth is one of the members.  She has been an active member of the La Florida group for two years and has developed a good friendship over the years.  She likes the loans because they help grow their businesses.

Ruth is 50 years old, in a common law marriage and has two married adult children.  Her son lives in his own home and her married daughter lives with her and helps with the expenses.  Her husband is a private employee.  She owns her house.

Ruth takes care of the domestic chores and cares for her grandchildren.  She also sells food and works from Monday through Friday, without a fixed schedule, so she can be financially independent.  She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients with which to prepare her products.  Her goal is to grow her business more.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Edit

texts.es:
María, se decidió por otro crédito para continuar realizando la venta de pan y satisfacer a sus clientes con los productos de su preferencia. Lo invertirá en la compra de pan, harina, azúcar y guineos para elaborar el budín.
Con el crédito anterior ella compro pan para la reventa, con lo que se ha mantenido trabajando y generando los ingresos que necesita para sacar su familia adelante, así como para cancelar su deuda adquirida. A la fecha ha aprendido a elaborar pan para su venta.
texts.en:
María decided to request another loan so that she could continue selling bread and satisfying the customers who prefer her products. She will invest in the purchase of bread, flour, sugar, and bananas for making pudding.

With her previous loan, María was able to buy bread for resale. She was able to continue working and generating the income she needs to help her family get ahead. María was also able to repay her debt. As of now, she has learned to make bread that she can sell.

loans.use: to buy bread, flour, sugar, and bananas.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 8 years with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo). She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is a mother of six children. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She then will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar, a sus 28 años de edad, es un campesino trabajador y pujante; actualmente trabaja como mayordomo en una finca ganadera desde hace varios años, por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en el manejo de ganado y sus cuidados. 
Con el ánimo de complementar sus ingresos, Oscar quiere comprar sus propias cabezas de ganado y aprovechar la oportunidad que su jefe le está brindando para tener sus propios animales en la finca donde trabaja; es por esta razón que solicita el apoyo del crédito y así poder iniciar con su nuevo proyecto productivo de manera independiente, logrando complementar su salario con las ganancias de su negocio para ofrecer mejor calidad de vida a su familia y, en un futuro, cumplir su sueño de tener una finca ganadera, en la que pueda trabajar de forma completamente indepediente.
texts.en:
Oscar is 28 years old, is from the country, and is hardworking and pushing of himself.  He has worked as a livestock farm manager for several years and has lots of experience in managing and caring for livestock. 

With a motivation to complement his income, Oscar wants to buy his own heads of livestock and take advantage of the opportunity that his boss has given him to have his own animals on his farm.  He is asking for this loan to start his new plan on his own, so he can complement his salary with the earnings from his business so he can provide a better quality of life for his family and achieve his dream of having a livestock farm in the future, where he can work completely independently.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is 50 years old and a married woman, a mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is Shamshad ’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Shamshad has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shamshad is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 38-year-old married woman; she has been stitching clothes for the six past years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is a 25-year-old lady; she has been in a beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time she has attained regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to deal with more customers day-by-day. For this she requires hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities so she applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 through Kashf Foundation. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Hafizan

texts.en: Hafizan is a 56-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small scrap business in her community for the past two years. She buys  various goods like plastic bottles, plastic stoppers, and similar material in scrap from the market, and after separating them based on their quality, she sells them to the people of her community and in local markets. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is the mother of six children and is motivated to provide for her family. Currently, Hafizan has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy stock of scrap material such as plastic bottles and stoppers, along with some cleaning material. She would then be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her fifth loan cycle, and has shown excellent repayment behaviour. She wishes to utilize part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of scrap material such as plastic bottles and stoppers, along with some cleaning material.

loans.name: Dúo San Antonio Group

texts.es:
DÚO SAN ANTONIO
El grupo está conformado por Clara Luz quien se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y pavos desde hace 25 años, tiene 6 hijos menores  de edad ella necesita otro crédito para comprar más cerdos y así mismo comprarles  la comida  para que en poco tiempo ella los pueda vender en otra aldea, su deseo es seguir adelante y poder  aumentar  su crianza de animales  y tener almacenado todo  tipo de comida para sus animales,esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Clara Luz is a member of the Dúo San Antonio group. She has been rearing pigs and turkeys for 25 years. She has 6 children who are minors and she needs another loan to buy more pigs and also to buy them food so that she can sell them in another village soon after. Her dream is to get on and to be able to increase her animal-rearing and to be able to store all types of food for her animals. She hopes that you can help her with the loan that she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy animals (pigs) to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 44-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. A mother of three children, she runs a sari-sari, or variety store, business selling various goods and commodities to the people in her place. She also raises and sells hogs. These are the sources of her income. 

Evangeline is asking for a loan for her store. She is requesting a loan to buy stock to sell, such as noodles, canned goods, soda and beverages, soaps and toiletries. Evangeline hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell such as noodles, canned goods, soda and beverages, soaps and toiletries.

loans.name: Rodolfo Fernando

texts.es: Rodolfo tiene 32 años de edad estado civil unión libre, vive con sus hijos de 7 y 5 años en el Cantón Urdaneta Provincia Los Ríos. Es integrante de ventanilla Palmasola que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Palmasola, pertenece a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. Rodolfo se dedica a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como abonos y fertilizantes. Las compras se realizan en el comercial Montenegro en Ventanas. Su sueño es mejorar la producción de los cultivos. El desafío que enfrenta es las malezas. En su tiempo libre le gusta ir al rio con su familia y jugar indor.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 32 years old and in a common-law relationship. He lives with his children (ages 7 and 5) in the canton of Urdaneta in Los Ríos Province.

Rodolfo is a member of the Communal Bank "Palmasola" which is located in the neighborhood of Palmasola in the parish of Ricuarte in the canton of Urdaneta. The members are farm workers and livestock breeders.

Rodolfo grows corn and rice. He is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies, such as compost and fertilizers. His purchases are made at the Montenegro commercial district in Ventanas. His dream is to improve the production of his crops. The challenges he faces include dealing with crop diseases.

In his free time, Rodolfo enjoys traveling down the river with his family and playing indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his corn and rice crops.

loans.name: Zemma

texts.en: Zemma is a 32-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like noodles, canned goods, soap, shampoo, and seasoning. She is a hard-working woman, willing to give her best to earn a living. Zemma is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more items to sell in her store such as soda, rice,canned goods, and snack foods. With this merchandise, she will be able to cater to her customers. Zemma hopes to improve her business so that it will generate more income for her family’s sustenance.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store such as soda, rice, canned goods, and snack foods.

loans.name: Ana Marisol

texts.es:
Ana, debido a los buenos resultados que tiene del uso de los créditos se ha decidido por solicitar más capital para invertirlo en la compra de embutidos, pan, bebidas, repollo, platanos, tomates, entre otros productos para continuar fortaleciendo el negocio.
Con la inversión anterior fortaleció el negocio de manera que aumentó sus ventas, tiene nuevos clientes, su economía ha mejorado con lo que se le facilita cumplir con los compromisos económicos que tiene.
texts.en:
