De manera alterna trabaja en el campo de la construcción por contratos, para complementar los ingresos con los que logra solventar las necesidades básicas de la familia.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará un refrigerador, con el ánimo de diversificar la oferta de productos, introduciendo lácteos, helados y cárnicos, esto le ayudará a incrementar las ventas y por ende los ingresos.
Nery manifiesta que su propósito a mediano plazo es poder fortalecer su negocio y convertirlo en un minimercado que sea reconocido en el sector, generando así una mayor rentabilidad y mejorar poco a poco la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Nery is a 44 year old woman. She is the mother of two children. She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner. During her productive life, she has worked in different stores and cafes in the city for ten years. She obtained experience and knowledge in managing these types of businesses. This is what prompted her to become independent and to start her own grocery store. The store is located in her house. She works there alone every day from the early hours of the morning. She now has worked six months generating income for her household. She alternates with working in the field of construction through contracts in order to complement the income to meet the basic needs of the family. 
Now she is requesting a the support of a loan in order to buy a refrigerator.  The aim is to diversify the selection of products by introducing dairy products, ice creams and meats. This will help to increase sales and profits. 
Nery said that her goal in the medium term is to strengthen her business and convert it into a mini-market which is recognized in the area. This will generate greater profitability and and improve her family's quality of life, little by little.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in the Nanyuki area in the central province of Kenya. He is 30 years old and is married with one child. He is also a businessman and he has been running a retail shop for four years now.

He knew Milango through friends and he decided to join so that he can access credit for his business. He now seeks a loan to buy sugar, rice, flour and cooking fat for his business. He hopes that in the next five years he will be running a wholesale business. The major challenge in the business is the scramble for few customers.

The extra income that he will raise from the business will improve his standards of living as well as buying a piece of land for his family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is a 48-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has three children. The youngest child is 10 and  the oldest is 17 years  old . She runs a 'sari-sari' variety store. She sells various items like cooking oil, powdered milk, sugar, shampoo and noodles. She requests a loan to buy additional stock of  soft drinks, canned goods, and other beverages in order  to maintain the inventory of her store and attract more customers. 

In the future,Gaudiosa would like to expand her business to provide her family with good living conditions and a quality education for  her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of soft drinks, other beverages, and canned goods.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana es una mujer muy trabajadora vive en casa de sus señores padres en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosi ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente a la elaboracion de calzados de cuero para damas principalmente repartiendo al por mayor a los puestos ubicados en la zona  buenos aires de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja muy responsablemente en conjunto con padres. Ella comienza su actividad en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosi de la ciudad desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, Emiliana necesita el credito para hacer realizar la compra de mas material (cuero,hebillas,goma para los tacos, etc.) y asi incrementar sus ingresos y ventas aprovechando de esta manera las fiestas de fin de año ya que se incrementa la demanda de calzados para su venta.

El sueño de Emiliana es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace junto a su familia, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a very hard working woman who lives with her parents in the zone of Villa Nuevo Potosi, a neighborhood in the city of La Paz. She makes women's leather shoes, which she sells in bulk to shops located in the Buenos Aires neighborhood of La Paz. She is a very responsible worker along with her parents. She begins working in her neighborhood at 6:00 a.m. and works until 10 at night. 

Emiliana needs this loan to purchase more material (leather, buckles, rubber for the heels, etc.) and thereby increase her earnings and sales. She will take advantage of the new year parties, when demand for shoes increases. 

Her dream is to increase her earnings through the sacrifices she and her family make, and to live peacefully when she gets old. She hopes to have a retirement salary that will permit her to live with a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy material like leather, buckles, and rubber for heels, etc. to continue in her business of making women's shoes.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a thirty-three-year-old hard working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce selling as his main source of income though he has other side businesses like agriculture where he earns an extra income. He started this business to generate income and sustain his family. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital, and price and weather changes that affect his produce business. He has a vision of buying and owning a piece of land.

He is requesting a loan to buy produce to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres unidas se llama este grupo que actualmente está en su segundo ciclo del programa de comités, además forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para ir creciendo y mejorando.
Una persona digna de destacar es la Sra. Maria, quien se dedica al humilde trabajo de venta de remedios naturales, con lo cual día a día lucha para poder ayudar a su familia. Es una persona muy sacrificada, que da todo por salir adelante y el día de mañana ser una buena microempresaria.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales para poder venderlos y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is known as Mujeres Unidas, or Women United, and they are currently in their second cycle of the committee program, as well as being a part of a program for the elimination of poverty in which everyone is participating in order to eliminate poverty and to continue growing and improving. 

One person worthy of highlighting is Mrs. Maria, who is dedicated to the humble work of selling natural medicines, a job she works every day in order to help her family. She is a self sacrificing person who gives her all in her efforts to get ahead and in the near future she will be a good small business owner. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in purchasing natural medicines to re-sell and to continue her business and to improve her earnings.

loans.use: Purchase natural medicine to sell.

loans.name: Percila

texts.en:
Percila is a  married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is  engaged in farming. She has grown rice for more than 10 years. In addition to  farming, she makes mats from  buri (palm). Percila asks for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and "buri" for mat weaving.

With a loan, she will be able to improve her farm thus augmenting her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and "buri" for mat weaving.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is 35 years old. She is married with three children. She has been selling rice, beans and maize flour for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, flour and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, flour and beans to sell.

loans.name: Servina

texts.en:
Servina is a married woman and a mother of three grown children from Talibon, Bohol. She is a farmer. She grows and sells rice. She has been farming rice for more than 10 years. Aside from farming, Servina makes native mats and hats from buri (palm) leaves to augment her income.
As of now, Servina is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm. Through this, she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora. María es una socia fundadora del grupo de crédito Mujeres de Chilcatotoras, vive por la parroquia de Tarqui en Cuenca, por su geografía accidentada tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente es amable, gentil y aún mantienen la cultura y tradiciones. Le gusta mucho formar parte de este hermoso grupo por la solidaridad y compañerismo que existe entre todas las socias.
Doña María tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y ha concebido 7 hijos, 5 de ellos ya son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su esposo es albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.
La Señora María se dedica a la agricultura, vende parte  de sus cosechas y el resto es para el consumo de su casa, también cría ganado, cerdos, cuyes y pollos. Tiene una tienda la cual  comenzó con su primer crédito que recibió.
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en víveres para su tienda. Su meta es agrandar su galpón de pollos para comercializar y ampliar este negocio.
texts.en:
María is a founding member of the 'Mujeres de Chilcatotoras' loan group. She lives by the parish of Tarqui in Cuenca, which, due to its hilly geography, has various places to enjoy nature. Its people are friendly and well mannered and they still maintain their culture and traditions. She really likes being part of this lovely group because of the solidarity and companionship that exists among all of the members. 

María is 58 years old, is married and has conceived seven children, five of whom are already married and live independently. Her two unmarried children help her financially. Her husband is a stonemason and they own the house they live in.

María makes a living from agriculture. She sells part of her crops and the rest is for home consumption. She also raises cattle, pigs, guinea pigs and chickens. She has a store that she started with the first loan she received. She is going to invest the money from the loan in buying chickens and foodstuffs for her store. Her goal is to enlarge her shed of chickens to sell and to expand this business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and foodstuffs

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, es un señor que disfruta dedicarse a la ganadería y a cultivar granos básicos, son oficios que aprendió de su padre desde que era un niño, actualmente vive con su esposa y tres de sus hijos, hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema en realizar esta actividad.
Con el capital comprara ganado para fortalecer su negocio, con lo que la productividad de productos lácteos aumentara y así tendrá más ganancias con las que pagara sus deudas y contribuirá con los gastos de su hogar.
Aspira contar con los ingresos que le den la facilidad de darle a su familia mejor salud, alimentación, educación y vestuario.
texts.en:
Isabel is a gentleman who enjoys raising livestock and farming staple crops, trades that he learned from his father from the time he was a child. Currently, he lives with his wife and three of their children. So far, he has not had any trouble carrying out this work.

With this capital, he will buy cattle to strengthen his business. His production of dairy product will increase and he will have more earnings with which to pay off his debts and to contribute to household expenses. He aspires to have an income that will enable him to give his family better health, food, education, and clothing.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, pepper, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 21-year-old single man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his family  in a small simple house. His uncle is a worker with a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Ibrahim is a student at a local university, where he studies public relations and marketing. He would like to finish his studies and find a job to help his family with some of their expenses.
 
Ibrahim took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ibrahim will be able to do his homework and reports easily. 

Ibrahim appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more scratch cards, African and European  movie discs, and gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
Abelardo vive en casa propia de sus padres en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Llojeta  de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de albañil. Abelardo necesita el crédito para la compra de material de construccion y asi mejorar su calidad de vida, comprara estuco, cemento, ladrillos y otros, para refacción de un par de habitaciones y dar mejor comodidad a sus dos hijos..

El sueño de Abelardo es poder terminar la construccion de la vivienda donde actualmente habita. esta es la tercera vez que su crédito será canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Abelardo lives in his parent's home that is made of brick and the floor is cement. It is located in the zone of Llojeta in the city of La Paz. He works as a bricklayer by profession. Abelardo needs a loan in order to purchase construction material and to improve his quality of life. He will purchase stucco, cement, bricks and other materials in order to repair a pair of bedrooms and to make his children more comfortable. 

His dream is to be able to finish construction on his home. This is the third loan that he will apply for via Kiva.

loans.use: purchase stucco, cement, bricks and more in order to repair a few bedrooms in his home.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 39-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, and a mother of three children. She earns a living by running a sari-sari or variety store where she sells various goods to people who live in her community. 

She is requesting a loan to buy additional items to sell to her customers, including biscuits, canned goods, chips, soda, rice, noodles, and toiletries. This loan will allow her to attract more customers and increase her business and her income. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to expand her business and make it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell  including  biscuits, canned goods, chips and biscuits, soda, rice, noodles, and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Akef

texts.en:
Akef was born in 1985. He is single and lives in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa with his six siblings and his parents. 

Akef noticed the financial crisis his family is facing. He decided to start supporting them by running a business selling clothes and stuffed animals for the last year. 

Now, he wants to expand his business by purchasing a larger quantity of clothes and selling pickles to increase his profits. He doesn't have enough money to expand so he has applied for a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and pickles for his business

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simon se dedica a la producción de leche junto a su esposa; tiene cuatro hijos  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, la producción de leche la vende a una de las Plantas industrializadoras de leche del departamento de La Paz.

Actualmente vive en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Umajalsu  del municipio de Achacachi a dos   horas y media de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado  las cuales le proporcionan leche, con cuya venta sostiene la economía de su familia.
.
El crédito  requiere para comprar  alimento y forrajes para su ganado vacuno.

El sueño de Simon es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado mejorando su alimentación.
.
Es la tercer vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Simon works in dairy production alongside his wife, they have four children who are all school age. The milk they produce is sold to one of the industrial plants in the department of La Paz. 

He currently lives in his own home located in the community of Umajalsu in the municipality of Achacachi that is about two hours from La Paz. He has a few heads of cattle who produce milk, the sale of which supports his family. 

The loan is needed to purchase feed and fodder for his cattle. 

Simon's dream is to increase his numbers of cows and to improve their nutrition. 

This is the third loan that he is applying for through IMPRO and his first with Kiva.

loans.use: purchase feed and fodder for his milk cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase chickens.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique, a sus 51 años de edad, se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre trabajador y dedicado a su familia, conformada por su esposa y 2 hijos.
Durante su vida productiva se ha desempeñado como comerciante independiente; comenzó hace 17 años comprando y revendiendo helados y cremas; luego se tuvo que trasladar de ciudad y donde se radicó surgió la oportunidad de vender los mismos productos, pero con la ventaja de que ahora él mismo los fabricaba, pues tomó cursos de capacitación y compró las máquinas para elaborarlos; en esta labor contaba con el apoyo de su familia y durante varios años tuvo muy buenos resultados; todo terminó cuando tuvo que regresarse para su ciudad natal debido a la violencia que se presentaba en el sector y que ponía en riesgo la vida de su familia y la propia; razón por la que perdió todo. Sin embargo, con empuje, empeño y mucha perseverancia decidió comenzar desde cero y nuevamente creó su microempresa; que ahora se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos.
El crédito que solicita es para realizar mantenimiento a las máquinas y comprar insumos al por mayor (frutas, azúcar, empaques, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y podrá mejorar el funcionamiento de sus activos y aumentar la producción; lo que le dará la oportunidad de vender más cantidad de productos.
Enrique sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, para generar empleos y en un futuro poder registrar su marca propia y posicionarla en el mercado; para generar mejor rentabilidad y brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Enrique is 51 years old and has been characterized as a hardworking man who is dedicated to his family, which includes his wife and 2 children.

During his productive life, he has developed as an independent merchant. Seventeen years ago he started buying and selling ice creams and creams. Later he had to move to the city, where he established himself when the opportunity emerged to sell the same products, but this time with the advantage that he made them himself. He took training courses and bought the machines to make the products. He had the support of his family, and for several years he had good results. It all ended when he had to move back to his hometown because of violence in the area that threatened his own life and the lives of his family. That was the reason he lost it all. Nevertheless, with drive, effort, and a lot of perseverance, he decided to start from nothing and recreate his micro business, which has now become his source of income. 

The loan he is requesting is to perform maintenance on the machines and to buy supplies wholesale (fruits, sugar, and packaging, among others). This will allow him to continue his work and to be able to improve the functioning of his assets and increase production. This will give him the opportunity to sell greater quantities of his products.

Enrique dreams of growing his business to generate work and in the future to register his own brand and position it in the market to generate greater profitability and to offer his family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his machines and buy supplies wholesale (fruit, sugar, and packaging, among others).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase iron, nails, wire and some tools.

loans.name: Venny

texts.en:
Venny is 44 years old. She is married with six children between the ages of  10 and 22. She sells various items in her boutique but with this loan she wants to buy  fresh milk, sodas and mineral water to  sell. 

She will save the profits.

loans.use: to  buy fresh milk, sodas and mineral water to  sell.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 49-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store where she sells different items of daily use like schools bags, stationery, biscuits and sweets.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy variety of school bags along with some packs of biscuits and sweets to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy variety of school bags along with some packs of biscuits and sweets.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en: Because hala is a conservative woman, she asked her brother to take her place in the picture. Hala is a 21 years old lady who lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her family. She is studying Bachelors’ majoring in Applied Arts and Design. She is in her 4th year and is only one step closer to graduation. Hala is planning to work in her study field after graduation to start her work life in order to help her family financially as they are currently facing financial crisis which is not helping them pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Elisamu Baguma

texts.en:
Elisamu is a 48- year-old married man living in Kamwenge- Uganda. He sells clothing as his main source of income. He started this business to earn a living and to look after his family. He faces challenges of competition, seasonal customers, and inadequate capital to meet high demands. He hopes to own a wholesale clothing boutique.

He requests  a loan to buy more  clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy quality clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy water glasses, blenders, plastic products, spoons, cups, and other items.

loans.name: Laith

texts.en: Laith is 29 years old. He is living in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his wife. He is studying Bachelors’ majoring in Political Science. He is in his 2nd year and is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his wife financially as they are facing financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Gracias  por apoyar a Julio, quien con su credikiva compró repuestos y bebidas frías que vendió rápidamente. Con este crédito se benefició porque tuvo un mayor surtido, ganó liquidez, incrementó sus ventas y sus utilidades. .Desde que  recibió este financiamiento, ha mejorado sus ingresos de negocio y de su familia, porque ha fortalecido su capital d e trabajo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará al por mayor y de contado cervezas, pues aprovechará la navidad y el año nuevo, época de mayor consumo para invertir bien. Así mismo comprará accesorios y repuestos, además de planes para tener más minutos a celulares y hacer de su inversión todo un éxito. Julio dice a sus financiadores: “Muchas gracias por el apoyo económico, he progresado paulatinamente, con Kiva y con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. “
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Julio, who quickly sold the replacement parts and cold drinks that he bought with his previous loan. With that loan, he benefitted because he had a greater selection, he earned ready cash, and he increased his sales and profits. Since receiving that financing, he improved his income for his business and for his family because he built up his working capital. 

Currently, he is applying for another Kiva loan, which he will use to buy beer in cash at a wholesaler. He will invest well by taking advantage of the greater consumption that occurs during the Christmas and New Year holidays. He will also buy accessories and replacement parts as well as prepaid minutes for mobile phones to make his investment a complete success. 

To his lenders, Julio says, "Thank you very much for the economic support. Little by little, I have progressed with Kiva and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo."

loans.use: to purchase beer in cash from a wholesaler. He will also buy accessories and replacement parts as well as pre-paid mobile phone minutes.

loans.name: Wasla Group

texts.en:
This group is called Wasla and consists of 6 ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. This group is requesting a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB in order to increase the members' activity levels.  

Wasla is the leader of this group. She is 39 years old and lives with her family in Hodeidah, Yemen. She sells ladies clothes, incense, perfumes and other goods. She has been in this business for many years and is experienced in sales, which allows her to make a better income. She works hard to offer a good life to her family. She has a regular customer base because they prefer the quality, affordable prices and good service that she offers. She is a resourceful and honest woman who is dedicated to her work.

She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy clothes, incense, and perfumes for her business.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, incense, and perfumes for her business

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия торгует одеждой секонд-хэнд, привезенной из Европы. Такой вид товара пользуется широким спросом среди населения в связи с трудной финансовой ситуацией многих граждан Украины. Более того, новая одежда часто оказывается неважного качества и по завышенным ценам. А в секонд-хэнде и качество неплохое и цены доступные. Наталия арендует точку на базаре, а также занимается выездной торговлей по областям. В этом бизнесе уже 2 года. 
Наталия надеется закупить товар по сезону, а также кофты, комбинезоны и постельное белье на сумму в 10 000 гривен. Из полученной прибыли планирует отложить часть средств, чтобы оплатить потом обучение дочери в медицинском колледже, что стоит недешево.
texts.en:
Nataliya sells second-hand clothing imported from Europe. This kind of merchandise is in high demand because of the difficult financial situation of many Ukrainians and because new clothing is often of low quality and overpriced. Secondhand clothing is generally of decent quality and affordably priced. Nataliya rents space at the local market and also travels to surrounding towns. She has been in this business for 2 years.

Nataliya hopes to purchase seasonal clothing items, as well as jackets, overalls and bed linens, for 10,000 hryvnia. She plans to save some of the profits to pay for her daughter's tuition to the medical college, which is not cheap.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing to sell

loans.name: Shtjefen

texts.en:
Shtjefen has four children; two of them are still going to school.  He was an immigrant for a very long time and supported his family in Albania with the money he made while an immigrant.  Two years ago, he came to his homeland and started building a house for the family.  Up until then they had been living in a house that was called a house, yet it was very difficult for the children to live in it.  Upon his arrival, Shtjefen started working at a construction company as a driver and his wife has been working in a factory that produces salamis, deli meats, etc.

Shtjefen wants to install doors and windows in his family home and he is almost begging lenders to help him financially through this loan.

loans.use: to install doors and windows in his family home shown in the background of the picture.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita, a 47-year-old married woman from the municipality of Getafe, Bohol, has two grown children.  For five years she has run a sari-sari (variety) store selling items such as shampoo, coffee, canned goods, noodles, eggs and cooking oil.

Crisita has requested a loan of 6000 PHP to buy noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, shampoo and chips.  In the future, she would like to expand her store to cater to more customers and offer more products at an affordable price.

Her income provides food and pays for basic household bills.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, shampoo and chips

loans.name: Manwati

texts.en:
Manwati is 39 years-old .  She is married and has 2 children, aged 19 and 14.  

Many years ago, she established her tailoring business.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business.  

In the future, Manwati plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Ma. Guadalupe

texts.en: Ma. Guadalupe is a  married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children; the oldest is 22 while the youngest is 8. She is engaged in a RTW (ready to wear) business. She sells shorts, pants, T-shirts and blouses. Her husband is a construction worker. Ma. Guadalupe is asking for a loan to buy various supplies like pants and shorts and other clothing products. With this, she will be able to cater to more customers thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy various supplies like pants and shorts and other clothing products

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda is 50 years old.  She is married to a civil servant and has been in the business for the past three years.  With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice and beans to sell.  With the profits from the business she will provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is aged 41.  She is married with one child aged 21, who goes to school.  

She owns a pub, and has been selling beers and sodas for one years after realizing selling retail items does not earn much compared to the pub.  With the loan, she would like to buy more beer to sell.  

With the profits from the business she will pay school fees for her child.  She was very happy with the previous loan which helped in expanding the volume of her sales.

loans.use: To buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Luljeta

texts.en: Luljeta is very thankful to the lenders for their generosity.  Due to this wonderful act, she was able to do basic renovations to her home. Also, her son has started working in the food industry and together they now make a better income.

loans.use: To replace the windows and front door in her home

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 40 years old.  She is married with four children.  

She has been selling various goods in her boutique.  With this loan, she wants to buy more soap, utensils and jerrycans to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more soap, utensils and jerrycans to sell.

loans.name: Umoja Virunga Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Musema est une commerçante d’une expérience de 12 ans, âgée de 52 ans et mère de 6 enfants, tous étudient. La cliente est présidente et membre d’une Association d’Affaires  «Umoja Virunga ». Senior entrepreur est vendeuse d'habillement. Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché mouvementé de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 2 ballons de friperie. Son conjoint est menuisier. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de post conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Musema is a merchant with twelve years of experience. She's 52 years old and the mother of six children, who are all studying. She's a member and the president of Umoja Virunga Group.

A senior entrepreneur, she sells various kinds of clothes in a busy market in her town. She's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, Hekima, to bolster her business. She's going to buy two bales of secondhand clothing. 

Musema's husband is a carpenter. She started her business with funds that she received from him.   

In the future, she wishes to increase her working capital, send her children to school, and provide them with clothes and food.

She thanks Hekima for its support towards female entrepreneur who are excluded from the traditional banking system, especially during this post conflict time in the East of the country.

loans.use: to buy two bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is aged 35. She is a mother of five children, all of whom go to school.  She sells clothes and has been in this business for the last five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more types of clothes for resale.  The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family as well as paying school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Elser Moises

texts.es:
Elser Moises tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Sallique, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, como principal cultivo la lima, también se dedican al comercio y ganadería, dicho distrito pertenece a la provincia de Jaén, ubicado en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con fincas fruteras de lima aproximadamente de 01 ha, dedicándose a este cultivo desde hace 15 años, también se dedica al cultivo de café y pan llevar en poca escala, la producción de lima lo vende en su caserío a los comerciantes de frutas quienes la llevan a comercializar a la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para invertir en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, comprando abonos y de esta manera tener un buena producción y cosecha oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elser Moises is 47 years old and lives with his wife in the Sallique district, a mainly agricultural community with lemon as its main crop, with other sources of income such as commerce and animal husbandry. This district is in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Perú.

He makes a living from agriculture, owning approximately 1 hectare of lemon orchards, and has been doing this for 15 years. He also grows coffee and sells bread to go in a small scale. The lemons he produces are sold from his home to fruit merchants who then take these to be sold in the city of Chiclayo.

He is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to invest in the maintenance of his crops, to buy fertiliser and therefore have a good production and opportune harvest for his customers, in this way generating more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser to maintain his coffee crop

loans.name: Les Enfants Unis 2.2 Group

texts.en: Jean-Aime is one of the members of the group Les Enfants Unis 2.2. He is the leader of a group consisting of four other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Jean-Aime manages two small boutiques as well as one taxi in town. Jean-Aime has been with HOPE Congo for five loan cycles having started in 2010. With this loan he will increase the stock of his shop with important items like water and soap for his clients. One day Jean-Aime dreams to open even more shops in Brazzaville and to invest in real-estate or a house. Ultimately, Jean-Aime is driven by his will to provide a way out of poverty for himself and his extended family.

loans.use: to purchase personal products, such as soap, for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cassava, banana, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 30 years old. She is married with two children. They all go to school. With the loan, she would like to buy more sodas, beers and mineral waters for resale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more sodas, beers and mineral waters for resale.

loans.name: Maria Martir

texts.es:
María, solicita capital para invertir en la compra de hilo, para la confección de hamacas, pues necesita cumplir con la demanda que tiene de sus clientes, para continuar fomentando su fidelidad hacia sus productos.
Con el préstamo anterior fortaleció el negocio lo que le ayudo a atraer nuevos clientes, mejorar su producción generar los ingresos que necesita para mejorar el estilo de vida de su grupo familiar, logro hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is requesting capital to invest in the purchase of thread for weaving hammocks. She needs to cover the demand from her customers so as to continue fomenting loyalty toward her products.

With her previous loan she strengthened her business, which helped her attract new customers, improve her production, generate the income she needs to improve her family's lifestyle and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy thread

loans.name: Miranda

texts.en:
Miranda is twenty six and married; she is been photographed with her little one, four years old. She has been doing agriculture the last five years since she got married. Her focus has been mostly on planting and selling onions and potatoes; the soil in her village and in the entire almost region supports these kinds of vegetables. In addition to agriculture, Miranda has been working as a seamstress in her village.
Miranda is requesting a loan to cover her mother’s surgery that hasn’t been scheduled yet, due to the lack of money. She is very hopeful that lenders will understand the situation she is in by kindly lending to her.

loans.use: to cover her mother's surgery.

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es:
Pablo, un campesino de 33 años de edad, es casado y padre de un hijo de 7 años; desde muy joven aprendió a realizar las labores del campo que aprendió de su padre. Actualmente tiene 100 palos de aguacate cultivados, 100 gallinas ponedoras y 30 pollos de engorde cuyas producciones son comercializadas en la plaza de mercado del municipio donde reside, adicionalmente y de manera alterna es propietario de una pequeña fábrica de vidrios, ambas actividades hacen parte de su fuente de ingresos con los que sostiene a su familia.
El crédito que solicita lo desea invertir en el fortalecimiento de su negocio agrícola, por ello comprará 150 gallinas ponedoras, 150 pollos de engorde, concentrado para alimentar los animales e insumos agrícolas (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes, fungicidas) para su cultivo de aguacates; esto le permitirá aumentar su capacidad de producción para incrementar sus ventas y mejorar los ingresos, además podrá enfrentar los diversos desafíos que se le presentan por los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas, que en algunas ocasiones no logran ser recuperados con la venta de la producción.
Pablo manifiesta que su proyecto es continuar fortaleciendo sus dos actividades para generar una mayor rentabilidad que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable y así poder brindar a su hijo una educación de calidad y una mejor calidad de vida para la familia.
texts.en:
Pablo, a 33 year old farmer, is married and the father of a 7 year old son. From a young age, he learned to perform farm work from his father. He currently has 100 avocado plants, 100 laying hens, and 30 fattened chickens. His products are sold in the market for laying hens in the town where he lives. He also owns a small glass factory. Both activities make up Pablo's source of income to support his family.

Pablo hopes to invest the loan he is applying for to strengthen his agricultural business. He will buy 150 laying hens, 150 fattened chickens, extract to feed the animals, and agricultural supplies (manures, pesticides, fertilizers, fungicides) to grow his avocados. This will allow him to increase his production ability and sales and to improve his income. He will also be able to face the diverse challenges he is faced with, such as the high costs of agricultural supplies which he sometimes does not make back with the sale of his products.

Pablo says that his project is to continue strengthening his two activities to generate a greater profitability that will guarantee a favorable stable economy  and in that way be able to offer his son a quality education and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 150 laying hens, 150 fattened chickens, extract to feed the animals, and agricultural supplies (manures, pesticides, fertilizers, fungicides) to grow his avocados.

loans.name: Subadra

texts.en:
Subadra is 36 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 18 and 17.  Many years ago, she established her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she suports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Subadra plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
 In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a 30-year-old single man from Lebanon.  He started working in 2005 as a mechanic and he is a very skilled and determined worker.  

He owns a car repair shop and has one part-time worker who helps him accomplish tasks more easily.  His work consists of changing a car's oil and he is also specially trained to repair particular types of cars. 

Today, Armen is looking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a large quantity of motor oil to serve his clients in a more efficient way.  As we mentioned above, Armen repairs specific kind of cars and presently he aspires to expand his field of work and to start repairing additional types of cars to earn a higher income.  

This is not Armen’s first Kiva loan and Vitas notes that he has been a very reliable client with payments on time.

loans.use: purchase a large quantity of motor oil.

loans.name: Nanu

texts.en: Nanu is 30 years old. She is married and has one child, age five. In 2002, she established her beauty parlor business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy cosmetics for her business. In the future, Nanu plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic goods.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a 49 year old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has eight young children. She engages in making and selling charcoal. She also sells fish to earn an additional source of income. She has been making charcoal for almost two years now. She requested a loan to buy more empty coconut shells, ten sacks for charcoal, and fishing nets. This will help Editha augment her income to meet the family's daily needs.

In the future, Editha would like to expand both of her businesses to improve her living conditions as well as to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more empty coconut shells, ten sacks for charcoal, and fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes such as pens, cups, plates, buckets, tubs, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: she will buy blouses, slippers, body cream, powder, etc.

loans.name: Elidio

texts.es:
El  Sr. Elidio tiene 35 años, está casado con la Sra. Dina de 32 años, ambos tienen dos hijos, por quienes están luchando y trabajando para poder darles todo lo que no pudieron tener, y que el día de mañana sean personas de bien.
Elidio tiene una Herrería en su casa,  y comenta que gracias a su buen trabajo se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, y gracias a eso está ayudando a su familia. Es conocido por ser una persona amable y servicial.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de hierros, que usará en su herrería, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elidio is 35 years old and is married to 32-year-old Dina. They both have two children for whom they are striving and working to be able to give them everything they weren't able to have, and so that they will be people of means in the future.

Elidio has a blacksmith's workshop in his home, and says that thanks to his good work he has assembled a very good customer base, and thanks to this he is helping his family. He is known for being a friendly and helpful person.

He is asking for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of iron, which he will use in his blacksmith's workshop and thus be able to keep working and  fulfilling his customer's requests.

loans.use: to buy iron to use in his blacksmith's workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coal, rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more locks, hinges, nails, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods such as coal, rice, onions, peppers, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more salt, pepper, onion, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Esperanza De Chipaca I Group

texts.en:
Located approximately 40 minutes outside of the Guatemalan highland town of Chichicastenango, ten motivated women organized themselves into the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Esperanza de Chipaca 1”. Their average age is 34 years and almost none of them have attended school. The women are weavers and mostly work in textile production. They create beautiful handmade textiles like the ornate Guatemalan blouses called “huipiles” (pronounced “wee-pee-les”), shawls, tablecloths and centerpieces. Generally, the women have large families and so it is essential that they look for ways to generate income to support their basic needs. The group recently welcomed three new members who are most excited about the possibility of a loan. They share this feeling with the other ladies in the Trust Bank who are all seeking ways to progress with this vital working capital provided by Friendship Bridge. The women will use the funds to invest in their businesses in order to maintain or expand them.

Elvira is one of the newest members of “Esperanza de Chipaca 1” and joined the group seeking a funding source to invest in her businesses and earn extra income. She is 26 years of age, married and has two young children. She needs to purchase additional materials for the production of textiles which is one of her businesses. Elvira also has a small orchard where she grows apples and peaches, which is typical of the area where she lives. She needs to purchase fertilizer at this time of year for maximum fruit production. Along with her husband, Elvira understands the importance of a good education for the children so that they can enjoy a more prosperous future for themselves and their future families.

Elvira is one of the few members of the Trust Bank who attended school. She had four years of formal education and longs to learn new things. Friendship Bridge offers monthly trainings at the meetings of each Trust Bank. The Friendship Bridge concept of microloans combined with educational trainings is called “Microcredit Plus”. The trainings cover various subjects like business administration and indebtedness, health and hygiene as well as women’s rights and self-esteem. The women form a strong bond with each other and learn about their identity as women and experience opportunities for leadership in the group.

The ladies of the “Esperanza de Chipaca1” Trust Bank look forward to this new loan cycle and the new opportunities and possibilities that are ahead in their lives. They are most appreciative to Kiva investors for believing in them. Armed with loans and education, they face a brighter tomorrow as empowered women eliminating poverty!

loans.use: to buy thread for textiles and fertilizer for growing apples and pears.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, biscuits, Vita, candy, oil, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Kabba

texts.en: This is 53-year-old Kabbah.  He is married and has 4 children aged 24, 21, 17 and 15. In 1997, Kabbah established his Muslim caps and beads business. He began his business just to enable him to settle his domestic problems. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are Muslim men and women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 650,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Kabbah has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy dozens of Muslim beads (Le 1,000,000) and dozens of Muslim caps (Le 3,000,000). He hopes that this loan shall increase his stock level. In the future, Kabbah plans to educate his children and complete the construction of his home. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy Muslim caps and beads.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for cooking condiments

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en: This is thirty-eight-year-old Memunatu. She is married and has three children aged four, ten and sixteen. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to help with the house chores. In 2002, Memunatu established her ladies' clothing business. The business started to help her husband with running the home. Her business is located in city center and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 1,277,125 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Memunatu requires a loan in order to pay for blouses, trousers, pants, and headdresses. She hopes that this loan can improve the stock and raise the profit. In the future, Memunatu plans to expand the business to a shop. She started the business by hawking around the market, now she has a stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for clothing.

loans.name: Villa Bonita 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité Villa Bonita 2 se formó luego de varias reuniones con las integrantes, y decidieron formar este grupo, son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por sus seres queridos. Una persona muy trabajadora es Aurelia, quien hace productos de limpieza y también vende ropas, ella es muy trabajadora, y lucha por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Aurelia día a día empieza su trabajo desde muy tempranas horas, y así es que está teniendo los ingresos para poder salir adelante. Su meta es poder tener su propio local y así tener una mayor clientela.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, para poder seguir con sus ventas y así tratar de seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The Villa Bonita 2 communal bank was formed after the members held several meetings and decided to form the group. These women are the heads of their households and are determined to take care of their loved ones. 

One very hardworking person is Aurelia, who makes cleaning products and also sells clothing. She is very hardworking and strives to improve her living conditions.

Day after day, Aurelia begins her work at a very early hour, and that is how she has the income to support herself. Her goal is to be able to have her own shop in order to have a larger clientele

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of a variety of garments to sell so she can continue with her sales to try to keep helping her family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of garments to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy apples, papaya, jocotes, pears, melon, etc.

loans.name: Ivan Jose

texts.es:
Iván, es casado, disfruta de una familia compuesta por su esposa y su hija de 6 años, su padre le enseño a dar mantenimiento y reparar motos, hoy lo hace de manera independiente, su horario de atención es de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m.
Necita comprar juego de llavee, bujías, llantas, entre otros artículos necesarios para seguir trabajando, espera contar con la fidelidad de sus clientes, aumentar sus ingresos, los cuales utilizara para cancelar sus cuotas y llevar el sustento diaria su familia.
Sueña con mejorar su economía y ampliar el local de su negocio.
texts.en:
Iván is married and enjoys having a family formed by his wife and their 6-year-old daughter. His father taught him how to do maintenance on and repair motorcycles. He currently does this independently. His operating hours are from 7:00 am until 4:00 pm.

He needs to buy sets of keys, spark plugs and tires, among other items that are necessary to keep working. He hopes to count on his customers' loyalty and to increase his earnings, which he will use to make his payments and to support his family on a daily basis.

He dreams about improving his income and expanding his place of business.

loans.use: to buy sets of keys, spark plugs and tires, among other items

loans.name: Iye

texts.en: This is 62-year-old Iye. She is married and has five children who are 39, 36, 33, 30 and 27. In 1990, Iye established her clothing and textiles business. She began her business just to enable her to solve her domestic problems. Her business is located at the city centre and her main customers are mostly women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Iye has already received and successfully repaid two loans. She now requires a new loan in order to buy ladies' shoes-1,500,000, wax cotton-2,500,000 and dry cotton-1,000,000. She hopes that this loan will help increase both her profit and stock level. In the future, Iye plans to rent a shop. She is saying thanks to Kiva. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy textiles and shoes.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: This is 31-year-old Theresa.  She is married and has two children who are three and seven years old. She has two additional dependents who live with her to help in the business.  In 2007, Theresa established her hair and products business. She began her business to help her husband run the home. Her business is located in city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 870,250 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Theresa requires a loan to pay for hair cosmetics. She hopes that this loan can improve her stock and raise her profit. In the future, Theresa plans to expand the business to other areas of the town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for hair products

loans.name: Maria Placida

texts.es:
María Placida tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su a esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se caracteriza por ser hospitalaria, también se puede encontrar exquisitos platos preparados en los restaurants de la zona, su población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una bodega, que con la ayuda de su esposo ofrecen abarrotes como leche, aceite, huevos, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, entre otros desde hace más de 6 años, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio y ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para capital de trabajo, compra de abarrotes para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Placida is 26 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the Oyotún district. It is a community known for being hospitable. You can also find exquisite dishes prepared in the restaurants in the area. The people work in business, agriculture and farming. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Perú.

She has a store. With the help of her husband, she has sold groceries like milk, oil, eggs, rice, sugar, soft drinks and other items for more than six months. Her business is located at her home. She requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles for working capital for purchasing groceries for her customers and generating more income for her family.

loans.use: buy groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for stationery.

loans.name: Junisa

texts.en:
This is fifty-one-year-old Junisa. He is married and has five children aged four, six, eleven, fourteen and eighteen. He has one additional dependent.

 In 1996, Junisa established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wants to be self-reliant after coming from the mines. His business is located in city center and his main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 2,990,100 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.

Junisa has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional shirts, trousers, and shorts. He hopes that this loan can increase the stock and expand the business. In the future, Junisa plans to improve the business and expand to other areas of the town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for used clothing.

loans.name: Livinus

texts.en: This is 51 year-old Livinus. He is married and has two children who are 12 and 8 years old. In 2003, Livinus established his clothing and textile business. He began his business just to get himself engaged in an economic activity. His business is located in the central business district and his main customers are mostly men. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 650,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Livinus has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy Muslims gowns for Le 3,000,000. He hopes that this loan improves his profit level. In the future, Livinus plans to develop his plot of land. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy Muslim gowns to sell

loans.name: Margarette

texts.en:
This is thirty-five year-old Margaret.  She is married and has three children aged  five, Seven and sixteen. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to help with the house chores.

In 1995, Margaret established her textiles business. The business started to help her husband with running the home. Her business is located in city center and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 1,668,575 every month from this business.

Margaret would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Margaret has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy cotton, wax, and batik. She hopes that this loan can improve the stock and raise the profit.

In the future, Margaret plans to expand the business to a shop. She started the business selling on market days, now she has a stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for textiles.

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en: This is 48-year-old Jeneba.  She is married and has 4 children aged 24, 20,18 and 15. In 1996, Jeneba established her condiment business. She began her business just to contribute to the running of the home. Her business is located at city centre and her main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Jeneba has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy sacks of onions, (Le 500,000) tomatoes (Le 250,000) and cartoons of maggi (Le 400,000). She hopes that this loan shall increase her stock level and hence her profit. In the future, Jeneba plans to develop her table into a shop. She is saying thanks to Kiva receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables oil, onions, Irish potatoes, jumbo Maggie, sugar and tomatoes.

loans.name: Tsogtgerel

texts.en: Mr. Tsogtgerel, 23 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a car driver at a private company for three months. During his day off, he provides taxi services to local people. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to pay for the remaining price of his car. The automobile he purchased is a natural gas vehicle, which emits less smoke and wastes less fuel per kilometer traveled. It is an environmentally friendly car and has the potential of contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to pay for the remaining price of his car

loans.name: Sreang

texts.en:
Sreang is 39 years old, married and a mother to seven children. She is a resident of a remote area of Prey Chhor district in Kampong Cham province. She makes a living by growing rice and other seasonal crops on a few plots of land. Sreang works hard to support her husband in tilling their farm and gives all her best for the sake of her children.

Sreang requests a loan to rent two hectares of farmland to grow cassava. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, supplementing her yield and income. For her future business plan, she aims to buy extra farmland to increase her business productivity.

loans.use: to rent two hectares of farmland to grow cassava.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more merchandise for her direct selling business, which she has had for 10 years now. Her income from her business is helping with their everyday household expenditures. She continues to work hard to provide for her family's everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Benita dreams that her business will continue and she hopes to have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Ramatu.  She is married and has two children who are nine and six years old. In 1999, Ramatu established her commercial (plastic and pan dishes) business. She began her business just to assist her husband in the running of their home. Her business is located at the city centre and her main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Ramatu requires a loan in order to buy pan dishes- 2,000,000 and plastic dishes- 3,000,000. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock level. In the future, Ramatu plans to educate her children, to build a house and to rent a spacious shop as the current one is small. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy plastic dishes and pan dishes

loans.name: Karayakhan

texts.ru: Караяхан 65 лет, вдова, вместе с супругом воспитали 14 детей, 9 сыновей и 5 дочерей. Караяхан удостоена почетного звания "Мать -героиня", также имеет звание "Заслуженный труженик села". У Караяхан - среднее образование, после окончания средней школы, работала в колхозе, затем вышла замуж за Жумана и родила 14 детей. Жуман скончался от болезни в 1999 году, до болезни супруг работал пастухом в селе. Из 14 детей-12 женаты, проживают отдельно и самостоятельно, младшие 2 сына проживают с Караяхан. В данное время Караяхан на заслуженном отдыхе, занимается сельским хозяйством и помогает своим детям. Караяхан все свою сознательную жизнь занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 40 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Караяхан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 1 лошадь, а также обрабатывает вместе с детьми 4,48 ГА земли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Караяхан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Караяхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадебное мероприятие сына.
texts.en:
Karayakhan is a 65-year-old widow.  She and her late husband have raised 14 children (nine sons and five daughters).  She was awarded the honorary title of "Mother Heroine" and also recognized as an "Honored Worker" of her village.  She has a secondary education.  After finishing school, she worked on a kolkhoz (collective farm) and then got married to a man named Juman who gave her 14 children.  Juman became ill and died in 1999.  Before his illness he worked as a shepherd in the village.  Out of the couple's 14 children, 12 are now married and living independently, while the two youngest sons  still live with their mother.

Karayakhan is now enjoying retirement, but she is still involved in agriculture and helping her children.  All her adult life, Karayakhan has been raising cattle and growing crops.  She started in this field 40 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 1,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she now owns one dairy cow, one calf and one horse and, together with her children, she cultivates 4.48 hectares of land and grows beans annually.  She makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, Karayakhan has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" to buy some cows and increase her cattle headcount.  She plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.  She is also planning to save enough money to pay for her son's wedding ceremony.

loans.use: to buy some cows.

loans.name: Anelia

texts.en:
Anelia is 38 years old and married with three children She runs a small sari-sari store business located in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines.   With the money she earns from her store, Anelia finances her children's education. She has worked for five years in her business.
 
Anelia asks for financial assistance amounting to 10,000 PHP from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. With the money, she will buy additional stock for her store.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en: Marivel is 42 years old, married and from Oroquieta. She is a microfinance member who has a rice trading business. She has signed up her membership to PMPC for her funding needs. Recently, she has applied for a loan to purchase bags of rice to sell. Someday, Marivel hopes to own a stall in the market to have more rice trading outlets.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Koeurn

texts.en:
Koeurn is married with three young children. He is 24 years old and lives with his family in Bakan district, Pursat province. Koeurn has been a farmer for over five years and primarily grows rice crops to sell in local markets. He always works hard in his daily farming chores, as farming is the main source of income for his family. He is happy because his wife gives him great support in tilling their farm.

Recently, Koeurn and two laborers, started construction on Koeurn’s latrine, but Koeurn used all of his money for the construction. That’s why he is asking for a loan to buy the materials needed to complete the unfinished construction of his latrine and pay for labor costs. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Koeurn is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of his family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to complete his latrine and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Mujizakhon

texts.ru: Мучизахон активная жительница города Исфары. Ей 36 лет. Она начинает новый бизнес в сфере торговли. Ее интересует купля и продажа фруктов. Мучизахон хорошо знает потребности рынка и верит, что ее новый бизнес будет успешным. Муж будет помогать ей в перевозке товара. Мучизахон с мужем воспитывают сына и троих дочерей. Детям необходимо дать хорошее образование, чтобы в будущем их профессия приносила пользу им и обществу. В связи с этим Мучизахон берет кредит, чтобы купить партию свежих сезонных фруктов и начать свою торговую деятельность, которая по ее словам будет прибыльной. Благодаря кредиту она сможет открыть бизнес и улучшить финансовое благополучие семьи.
texts.en:
Mujizakhon, age 36, is an active resident of the city of Isfara.  She is currently launching a new retail business and is interested in buying and selling fruits.  She knows the needs of the market and believes that her new business will do well.  Her husband will be helping her to transport her merchandise.

Mujizakhon and her husband are raising a son and three daughters.  They really want to give a good education to their children, so that in the future, they can have jobs that will help them in life and also benefit society.  With this goal in mind, Mujizakhon is taking a loan to buy a batch of fresh seasonal fruits and start her new business, which, she believes, will be profitable.  This loan will help her to open her business and improve the financial situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits and start a new retail business.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 60-years-old, happily married and lives in Poblacion, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. In order to earn a living she invests her money so she can have a piggery to generate income. With a desire to earn more, she decided to expand with additional pigs.

Through Paglaum MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed.  Now, she requests a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to her husband's income.

loans.use: To buy feed for hog raising

loans.name: Teresa Marisol

texts.es:
Teresa, se dedica a vender tamales y antojitos, como forma de generar ingresos para apoyar a su compañero de vida en los gastos de su hogar, no tiene hijos, vive con su compañero de vida, lo hace de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m., por el momento no representa ningún problema.
Invertirá en la compra de maíz, pollo, frijol, aceite, leña. Contando con la materia prima necesaria c0ontinuara trabajando para hacer crecer el negocio, espera aumentar sus ventas y cancelar sus deudas.
Sueña con mejorar sus productos y atraer más clientes.
texts.en:
Teresa works selling tamales and popular snacks as a way of generating income to help her life partner with the household expenses. She doesn't have children and lives with her spouse. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. For now, this does not present a problem. 

Teresa will invest in the purchase of corn, chicken, beans, oil, and firewood. By having the raw materials necessary to continue working and growing her business, she hopes to increase her sales and pay off her debts. She dreams of improving her products and attracting more customers.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, beans, oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Phant

texts.en:
Originally from Pursat province, Phant is 30 years old and a married mother of three children for whom she provides. To deal with the financial constraints in the family, Phant has dedicated herself to a farming business, growing rice on her own agricultural land of one and a half hectares. Nowadays, she is able to earn approximately KHR 20,000 per day. 

Phant has been a client of HKL’s for five previous loans, which she has fully repaid. The positive impact of her past loans has helped her improve her farming business as well as general living conditions. This time she is asking for a new loan to build a hygienic latrine for her family. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Phant is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her family.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino is a 41-year-old seaweed farmer living in Talibon, Philippines. For more than ten years now, he has been in the seaweed farming business. He works hard to support his family - a wife and their four children ages 6-16. He is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy plastic rope, fuel and wooden stakes.

In the future, Faustino hopes to further improve his business and maybe invest in a more lucrative venture. 

He also aims to educate his children for their brighter future and have some savings.

loans.use: to buy plastic rope, fuel and wooden stakes

loans.name: Mawar Group

texts.en:
Passing the 6 months of the loan period, the Mawar group can run the pig business well. The pigs grow healthy and fat. They give them nutritious feed and vitamins. The group also got a high price when they sold the pigs together to the big buyer. Most of them are satisfied with the result.

Ni Komang sold all of her pigs. Having support from her husband, she is determined to increase the business to support the income of her family. Becoming one of the sources of family income, Ni Komang continues her loan to increase the pig business. With full support from her husband, Ni Komang will use her loan to purchase 3 local piglets for a pig barbecue. The local pigs will be sold every 2 months. 

The advantage of the business is to pay school fees. She hopes her children can get a higher education for a better future. 

Now with 10 members, the group receives a 15,000,000 IDR loan, and Ni Komang receives 1,500,000 IDR. She hopes that with the plan running smoothly, she can earn more profit. 

Ni Komang is in the front row, number 2 from the right, next to the woman with the baby. She’s wearing a yellow shirt.

loans.use: to purchase three local piglets

loans.name: Dúo Nueva Jeneración Group

texts.es:
DUO NUEVA GENERACION
La señora María de 38 años de edad, casada,  desde hace 5 años posee una Tienda ubicada en la calle principal de la Colonia San Rafael Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de señora María Chicol es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE para superarse más en su negocio; con el préstamo quiere comprar más productos de consumo diario  para seguir creciendo con su tienda.
texts.en:
NUEVA GENERACION DUO
Maria is 38 years old and is married.  For 5 years she has had a store located on the main street of the San Rafael community in Chimaltenango, which she was able to establish with effort and by making improvements to her home.  With her business she has supported and raised her family.  Maria's dream is to improve the quality of life for herself and her family through the microcredit loan that she is requesting from FAPE, in order to get ahead with her business.  With the loan she will buy more commonly-used food products in order to continue growing her store.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
Chamroeun is a 34-year-old married man from a remote area of Kampong Cham province. He has been in the business of farming rice for more than 16 years now and has the support of his wife. The key to the success of his business is to give all his effort and determination to achieve goals that he has expected. Through his hardships, he aims to provide enough food for his family and send his children to school.

In order to further develop his farming business, Chamroeun has requested a loan of USD 600 to add to his own capital to buy a threshing machine, which will be used in this harvesting season. In the future, he would like to expand his farming business to be able to improve his general living conditions and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy a threshing machine.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is a married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has eight grown children. She raises hogs. She has been in the hog-raising business for ten years now.
